Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chewy110
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in August on a stopover from UK to Australia. This was our first visit to Hong Kong and it was good. The hotel is in a very good location a five minute walk from the harbour front in Kowloon. They offer a free transfer from Kowloon rail station to and from the airport. The staff are friendly and conceiage staff very helpful with directions sightseeing tips etc. We had a few drinks in the hotel bar and the barman was very pleasant. Hotel room was good size double room, clean my only issue was we couldnt open a window and there was a slightly damp smell of fousty air conditioning when we first got to the room. This did wear off as soon as we turned air con on. We had breakfast in hotel one morning but I wouldnt really recommend it as we got to the dining room at 10.30am and told we were too late for the buffet and had to order from the menu which was expensive for what we actually had when there were so many places close to the hotel we could have gone instead. It was slightly annoying as the buffet was still out but the staff were just starting to clear it away and still said no. There is wifi access in the hotel but it is not free although if you drink in the bar they will give you the access code. I would stay here again for ease and location as the rooms are good the staff are friendly but just dont use the dining room. There are loads of places nearby to eat and drink. Shops are very close and if you are on a short stay I highly recommend doing the Big Red Bus Tour. Fantastic was to see Kowloon and Hong Kong Island if you are pushed for time it also included tram and ferry tickets. On the whole great location, clean hotel friendly staff for a short stay I recommed it for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, decent sized room”
Reviews.Author: Syllaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Hotel for 4nights at superior room. It was in 7th floor. Room itself was of decent size, I would say its huge compared to other HK hotels, came with LCD TV, desk, wardrobe, two chairs and one coffee table. There was even a corner for luggage. Bathroom was huge, with bathtub. Room and bathroom were clean, pleasantly designed. Housekeeping was great too, they never fail to replace all the used items and provide two bottles of water even though the water from previous day was still untouched. Staffs were helpful, friendly and efficient. Quick with smiles, speak good english and check in check out was done in less than five mins. I had problem with in room safe so I called reception. Within 6mins (from the time i called), my problem was solved. Excellent service. Location was really the selling point. Five mins walk from Exit B2, Tsim sha tsui MTR at leisure pace. There was two doors, one main door and one side door. I used side door all the time, closed around 12 midnight and it is along Cameron Rd. Around hotel, there are a lot of eateries, convenient stores, shops such as city chain, croc, sasa, etc. Even shopping malls with supermarkets are just around the corner. Knutsford terrace for dining and drinking is nearby too. The surrounding is crowded, well lit (shops closed around midnight). I felt safe all the time when I walked around hotel area even at midnight. Opposite hotel side door is the K4 bus stop (free bus shuttle to airport express Station). Make sure you stand right beside the bus sign and spot the bus (mini bus, blue color) as early as possible and wave for it frantically. The bus driver drove passed us even though we waved for it. Perhaps we didnt wave in big gesture so he didnt see us. Overall, Park hotel is excellent. Great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Checkin delay, Key card problems, good location”
Reviews.Author: davidoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one day with my family. We are booked 4 rooms before hand and though we reached only by 2:30-3:00, the front desk staff said only one room will be available for the time being and we will have to wait till 4pm for the other rooms. The key card to one of the 4 rooms kept on getting blocked and we had to go down to the reception every time to get that replaced.the rooms were small but clean. The location of the hotel was really good with lots and lots of fast food restaurants around it. Breakfast was good and had lot of variety. Housekeeping staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Rooms and Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: thinklocalrideglobal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a quick stop over in Hong Kong and chose the hotel based on location. Aside from the location, our stay provided us with no other reason to consider ever returning as there were too many inconsistencies in the product quality and service level during our stay. We did not receive a warm greeting or really much of a welcome from any of the staff (no smile, hello, good morning/evening or head nod) when we encountered them during our stay; except from the housekeepers who would smile and say hello in the morning in the hallways. When we arrived, the duvet cover was dirty and it took over 1 hour, 3 staff and 4 stained duvet covers for the hotel to provide us with an unstained duvet cover. Perhaps most disappointing was that during this duvet fiasco, we were never once offered an apology... terrible. We also found that the staff's proficiency level with English was rather low considering that the property is in a location that caters to (a) tourists and (b) business travelers. Additionally, I was surprised that English language abilities varied quite drastically from Front Desk Agent to Front Desk Agent as I surely would have thought that there would have been a higher base-line proficiency required to be in a position of that nature with such a high level of guest interaction. Overall the property seemed dated, with the exception of the washroom which was well maintained, and it did not have the metropolitan-feel that the website portrays. We were disappointed with the actual product quality relative to the marketing that has been done for it online.

Reviews.Title: “fine for business stay”
Reviews.Author: LVLTO
Reviews.Content: Was booked in here by a colleague when we were in Hong Kong for three nights. Hotel was chosen for its proximity to our meetings. From the reviews I wasnt sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Although my room was small it was well equipped and I lacked nothing. It was spotlessly clean, quiet, the air conditionning was efficient, lighting was fine and there were good blackout curtains (important when recovering from a 12 hour time difference). Breakfast was included and offered good choice. Although some people in reviews had complained about staff attitude I found them all to be very courteous and helpful. My only complaint was regarding internet access. I only travel with my IPAD and when I checked in was told that wireless was not available on the floor my room was on., They moved me (hence the very small room) however the wireless was not reliable. I assume someone was trying to download movies because I was regularly "kicked off" email. Other than that no complaints at all and would recommend to anyone needing a reasonable place to stay in that part of Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KP117
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night and was amazed by what a small size room can provide. The room is small but well organized and everything is clean and tidy. Food outlets and shoppingalls are all within walking distance. I walked to Avenue of stars, Nathan Road (lots of shopping can be done here), and Temple Street. Short and great stay. Will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chezmuzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel, Kowloon for 5 days. Is located pretty well for food and is a 5 minute walk to the underground railway system. The hotel was well kept and rooms a really good size. The amenities were also good. It is a little difficult getting in and out of because of it's position, but we didn't find it too bad. It was extremely busy with people coming and going all the time during our stay, so I gather is very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: handison
Reviews.Content: The room is small so not worth for the price I paid. The check-in and check-out is fast but clear signages should be place near counter to let guests know where to check-in or check-out. I stand infront of counter for quite a while not sure where to check-out. The Front Desk staff just stare at me without directing me to the correct queue. The location of the hotel is great, near shopping centres and MTR. Easy to get around. The concierge is friendly and helpful. The airport shuttle is provided for hotel guests. Overall is good but would be better if rate are cheaper, because for this rate, I can get better place.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: JandJ68
Reviews.Content: We only had 2 nights here for a whistlestop tour of Hong Kong, The hotel is certainly well situated in the main shopping area of Tsim Sha Tsui and within walking distance to the waterfront and to the MTR however, I didn't feel like a welcome guest. It was quite impersonal. The room was adequate but on the small side but had everything that a traveller would require, however there is no bath in the bathroom. Our "view" such as it was, was the back of a very old apartment building across an alleyway but as we didn't spend much time in the room, that was OK. There is wifi available but it is billed and is only available in the lobby. And the lobby as such consists of 4 lounges so there is not much room to be comfortable or have any privacy if you only have an i-phone or i-pad to connect to the internet. I'd probably stay there again simply due to its location but its nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Overall value for money.. However some staff training is advised”
Reviews.Author: Luis_HK
Reviews.Content: I believe this Park hotel is one of the value for money hotels around - even though not the cheapest in town. Location is great - at the heart of TST allows us to shop around the area... Airport Express shuttle bus stop at entrance is another plus, as this prevent massive walking with big luggages in HK streets. Checking in takes a while as the front desk experience some trouble locating a room for me - not a big enough concern for me as that still take less than 10 minutes. We're given 3 rooms; 2 decently sized and 1 small room - so if you're after standard sized rooms normally seen overseas, upgrade your rooms; If you're planning to book superior rooms, avoid corner rooms. Toilet amenities are adequate - you'll get the standard sets but not of superior quality. Bed is fairly comfortable, it's interesting that Park Hotel is still using fairly dated air-con and light controls. Air-con performance is not very stable. TV is small with some selection of cable TV channels...However I don't think this is what you come to HK for? In terms of the room condition I'm slightly disappointed as it still looked a little dated even though there're some renovations done a few years ago. There's one point that I've noticed during my stay - The staff are generally polite and helpful however some of them have problems with communication in English/Mandarin. They're usually friendly when speaking in Cantonese (No problem for me since I speak Cantonese); however they sound DEMANDING and sometimes HOSTILE when speaking in Mandarin and English. Management might want to train up the staff in communication - it would really be a shame if a customer is angered/annoyed not due to bad attitude but poor choice of words/speech. I would probably expect staff at front desk and conceirge to speak fluent (if not polished) English and Mandarin. It's very evident that the staff are struggling when they're communicating with customers who speak English/Mandarin in heavy accent. Noticed that some of the reviews mentioned rude staff - that might be one of the reasons! Overall the stay is pretty pleasent, although it has gone through a face lift a few years ago, somehow I still feel that the hotel needs a little more touch up. Price offered by the hotel is reasonable and I felt is fairly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel much..and will stay there for sure..and even recommend others too”
Reviews.Author: G_Niraj
Reviews.Content: Its biggest advantage is location..location and location...This hotel is in the heart of Kowloon peninsula...markets..restaurants..malls and everything that can a traveler needs was around... The concierge and the hotel staff were very helpful...The small problem is their way of pronunciation of English which people from India and other part of the world may find difficult to understand. But this will not change my opinion about the hotel, you were superb Park. My daughter pressed DO NOT DISTURB when we went out for Disney tour..and we came back only about mid-night. But the room service was so prompt..they made my room during the mid-night and changed everything when told..Upon being told of my hobbit of taking STRONG TEA..they provided a whole bunch of tea bags complimentary. It was great...small small things counts and makes it big. The Park Cafe..the Hotel restaurant, was on 4th floor, I found it too good with variety of option available...The restaurant staffs were so very helpful and always smiling. The hotel provides on screen message to all the guest be it from Hotel or from your tour operator for that matter. Besides this they also drops such messages in Hard copy to your room with the persons to contacted with details. This hotel provides Internet access through LAN and through WI-FI but a paid service and hence i didn't use this. The Hotel charges 900 HKD upon check-in. You may get the amt. blocked in your credit card or pay it upfront in Hard Cash. This was a bit difficult....

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betty_HK_BA
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hong Kong many times and I always stay at Park Hotel. This hotel is very convenience both shopping and transportation. It's in the central of town. Rooms are big than other hotel in HK, clean and all staffs are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: gold_fish333
Reviews.Content: The main entrance to the hotel has moved to another street since refurbishments were completed, but most taxi drivers appear to be unaware of this. We were dropped off at the old entrance (now the back) and had to drag our luggage into the hotel ourselves, which is not fun when it's on a crowded street. Room decor was average (a little dark) and the bathroom is tiny. Bed was too hard for my liking, giving me a sore back everyday. Location is excellent - heaps of eateries and shopping close by. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SquirrelTheCat
Reviews.Content: The pros: very helpful staff, good tour desk, great central location, excellent buffet breakfast with lots of choice, we needed two rooms and were allocated interconnecting rooms as requested. Cons: bad first impression - we arrived very late at night from a flight from Australia with 3 kids aged 10 and under, and our rooms were not ready. We had to wait around reception for 30 mins or so before we could go to the rooms, then instead of being able to go to bed, we had to wait in our rooms for another half an hour while they eventually bought in the extra beds and made them up - not the most fun when you have really tired children and you've just come off a long flight. The only other "down side" as such would be the limited dinner menu both via room service and from the in-house restaurant - but, as we stayed there for 10 nights probably anything would get a little old after a while so this was not the biggest deal. General: Despite the first blip, we enjoyed our stay and would happily stay there again. The hotel is good value for money and the staff were very accommodating - we booked a one day tour into Southern China and the staff were good enough to make up a breakfast for us to take away (in lieu of the buffet) since the buffet would not be open before we departed. Staff were always friendly and helpful, everything was clean. It is easy to walk to the MTR. The rooms are a litlte on the small side but that is made clear in their website so that did not bother us. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: zai28
Reviews.Content: Ok...the entrance to the hotel and reception area is a bit tight and underwhelming and the view from the room was a bit poor, however that didn't take away from our stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for exploring Hong Kong, the room (deluxe) was great, staff was friendly and we had a comfortable stay. Stayed here with my wife and 2 year old son. Extra bed fit perfectly in the room and we still had a lot of space. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Xotica123
Reviews.Content: Small lobby. Poor selection for breakfast. Congee was very watery and only lukewarm, v. plain, sad offer of condiments. Small room. No wifi or internet unless u pay. Dour staff. Location and surroundings not that brilliant. No pool. Toiletries supplied were not that good. I wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude security staff”
Reviews.Author: Lola W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Park hotel from 3/06/2012 to 6/03/2012 , check in was fast , everything was good. Until 1 day, before leaving the hotel for our tour , I tried asking a man who dressed in a suit standing near the concierge. I went over and said : excuse me, do you know ... before i can even finish my question. He raised his voice at me and said : GO ASK THE FRONT DESK, i replied, i'm sorry ? He repeat the sentence . GO ASK THE FRONT DESK and walked away. I was taken aback and appalled, how rude this man could be. Later in the night, i called front desk and I found out he's a security staff, named of Mr TSANG. Rest assured this incident prevented me from staying at this hotel and of course , warn my fellow mates about this.

Reviews.Title: “good for families and muslims”
Reviews.Author: mellenur
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights from 5-7june. booked online direct on the hotel website (book superior room with complimentary upgrade to deluxe room). check in was fast and we were on the 5th floor. we were with 2 kids (3yrs old and 10mths old), and got a queen bed and a cot bed with clean bedding. room was quite spacious but i drew the curtains on the small window as there was no view. my sister booked a deluxe plus room with 2 double beds which fit in 2 adults and 2 children comfortably. toilet was clean. breakfast was decent (cereals, juices, breads and pastries, cheese and spreads, congee and oatmeal, and indian food). location was good with 2 entrances to the hotel, one with direct access to busy shopping street. ebeneezer kebab was just one street away on prat ave (good food but pricey). considering we were there more for sightseeing, we should have stayed at hong kong island instead. took cab to victoria peak and ocean park cost about HKD 80-100 per way. i believe theres no pool or gym in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: sk84fungirl
Reviews.Content: To ensure I was posting my comments for the right hotel, I reviewed the photos just to confirm as this is NOT SO GOOD. Arrived from Beijing and checked-in with a group of 12. This was the last of a 4-city tour. We arrived and checked in about 9:00 pm. About a 45-minute drive from the Airport and located across from HK Island in Kowloon. Check-in was simple as the group guide handled everything. This was the first of 4 hotel stays that each room had to leave credit cards for deposits. Not a big deal, just did not have to do it at the prior hotels. Entered hotel from the Cameron road entrance. Fairly small lobby with concierge and registration desk. Located at the corner of Chatham and Cameron Rd. Very busy area and easy walk to waterfront, shops, Nathan Road, and subway. The room is average Western hotel size but with twin beds. Note that we found the beds to be hard. But it was not as hard as our Shanghai hotel stay. It was manageable and we were able to sleep fine with minimum exterior noise. The bathroom was avg size with awesome shower head. Amenities were included and it was clean. The room had great technology that allowed us to manage the lights from the bed. The room was a little dark, even with all the lights on. Again it was manageable. We awoke after checking in and prepared for tour. Roommate indicated she had a scratchy throat. We headed to breakfast on the 4th floor which was included in our plan. It is a buffet with a great selection for guests from multiple countries. Everything in the cafe was clean and the buffet was good. Did some touring and returned late to rest. The next morning we each woke with scratchy or sore throats. As we spoke to others in our group, learned that several had the same symptoms. We returned early to our room and found it quite stuffy so turned the air down. When returned later that night after dinner, our room was freezing and our comforters and clothing felt damp. We figured it was due to the humidity. The next morning we met up with some group members and went to Big Budda. During the ride we talked about our trip and hotel. We learned that we had the same challenges. Damp clothing and bedding as well as scratchy throats. When we got back to the hotel, we stopped at the front desk and told them our challenges. It was then that we learned there was a mold problem!!!!! I truly believe the person that told us let it slip. Because it was our last night, we decided to stay in the room. When we got to the room, we realized that the black marks all over the walls in the room was mold. We slept with our masks on thinking that we would be fine. Well, we progressively got worse and each woke with stuffy heads and sinus problems. Called the front desk to speak to the manager and let him know about our challenges. By this time, I'd lost my voice and it was obvious I was sick. The manager was gracious with offering assistance for anything we needed. He sent up extra water which we definitely needed as we warned water for neti pots ans tea. We must have looked really bad to the person that delivered the water. After he left, we got another call asking if we would like a doctor's consultation. I will admit, we were in pretty bad shape. And it was terrible as we were headed back to the states (36 hours of traveling). While we waited to check-out, we were approached by a different manager about our stay and to confirm our room number (#620). He apologized for our stay. As we talked, another in our party expressed her disapointment. Turns out that we were all on the 6th floor and all had a scratchy throat of dampness in our rooms. Needless to say, I cannot recommend this hotel. As I type this review, I am still sick. I am confident that it is no cooincidence that several in our group got sick and only after checking into this hotel. The air-conditioning system is not working well to combat the HK humidity. This is something that needs serious work.

Reviews.Title: “Ok I guess . . .”
Reviews.Author: BrendanL26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, close to Nathan Street and the Waterfront. The rooms are spacious - especially after staying in hotels in Japan for a week. The hotel was let down by the small things, my room had th stale smell of smoke despite being a 'non smoking room' and everything felt a little old and used. It wasn't bad but wasn't great either.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: gcgcgc
Reviews.Content: Good position and room service. Crowded breakfast with many tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: toomanynames
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Hong Kong where we stayed at the Park Hotel. Great location, easy to get around either on foot or by the metro. lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. The rooms have recently been refurbished and are of a great standard. Bathrooms are beautiful. All well cleaned daily. Breakfast buffet was amazing offering something for all backgrounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Anika022
Reviews.Content: First time in Hong Kong and definantly not the last. The hotel was located in a great spot surrounded by shops and places to eat. The service was great, check in was fast and staff were very helpful. Rooms were cleaned daily and at a great standard. The concierge was a great help when asking for directions and anything else we needed. The hotel was located a short walk from the Metro Station which was easy to use and a great way of getting around. We went as a couple and found the room to be a perfect size, not small atall. The breakfast was nice, there was a lot of choice. Great Small boutiques around the hotel and on all the side roads.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong stay”
Reviews.Author: hassiak
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Hong Kong last week and had a stay at the Park Hotel, Chatham Rd. I had stayed there previously a few years back and found it very central but a little old. This time round, the hotel has had a bit of refurbishment and the rooms are bright. We had booked a superior room with a rollaway as there were 3 of us. On checking in, we were advised that we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. There were 2 large twin beds and a rollaway and still plenty of room to walk around. The bar in the lobby has happy hour every night - very good wines and value. The staff were friendly and very helpful as were the housekeeping ladies. Across the road (Cameron Rd entrace) there is a fantastic noodle eatery which is opened 24 hours. We arrived at the hotel at about midnight and felt a little peckish and discovered this gem. Delicious steamed prawn dumplings, chicken wrapped in steamed tofu. The next night we had dinner there - the deep fried wontons are to die for, as is the salt and pepper tofu. The day before we left I had to have lunch there - delicious. I will definitely be back at the Park Hotel for my next Hong Kong trip and definitely back at the noodle eatery - I just wish I knew the name of that place. M'goy

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: tasiwafam
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very busy.. but the check in process very fast and easy. our room was nice, clean and spacious for standard hotel in hongkong. you can find anything around the hotel.... it was a really nice hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PoobenShailou01
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with great service. Provided a very nice cot for our ten month old son with a Pooh Bear duvet! Very nice. we needed to change rooms as our firts room did not have a bath tub so they changed our room with no complaints and even moved us - all this at 1:00am. The rooms are neat and clean with plenty of storage space - vital for all our son's stuff, which is more than ours! Breakfast is okay but limited in variety and pretty much the same thing everyday. The hotel is 5 minutes from the MRT station so very handy. Nathan road, ladies market are all in walking distance. The nightly light show can also be seen from the waterfront that is also within walking distance. Good hotel and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2265
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night before my departure from China, Hong Kong. The hotel staff was very friendly. The room was not too small as people have stated. I found both the room and the bathroom very clean. I had a nice view from my room and it was quiet. It was an easy walk with all of my luggage from the nearby metro station. The free airport shuttle picked me up directly in front of the hotel and dropped me off at the airport express check-in in Kowloon. It was all very easy. The hotel is centrally located in Kowloon with plenty of great restaurants and shopping nearby. I would stay again and recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good room with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnnChiong
Reviews.Content: Rooms that we checked in were ok, clean and tidy. Excellent location, right at the shopping areas and lots of food store. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: globalreach
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel, even though I've been to Hong Kong many times. The rooms were exceptionally large for this area and as anyone who travels here know, they are usually about the size of a big closet. Nice friendly staff; bathrooms were clean and well functioning with a fairly good size shower. The room had all the necessary amenities including a safe, remote control lighting, flat screen TV and good toiletries. All in all it was a great value and you could not ask for a better location in TST; right in the heart of things. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: wahinetoaAuckland
Reviews.Content: Our agent booked this for us - it is a perfectly fine hotel. The staff were very attentive and the rooms clean and tidy with everything that one would expect. Excellent location - very central. Also, free bus meets the express train from the airport - highly recommended - do not take a cab - too expensive, unnecessary and usually hair-raising. One concern - we paid for breakfast and were told that it finished at 10.30 (good for us as we were jet lagged and needed a sleep in). We went down at 10.15 and they were basically packing everything up around us which made us feel very uncomfortable (and took the edge of the last day of our trip away) and they told us very clearly that we had to be out of there by 10.30. I complained that we were feeling chased out of the place and if they needed people actually gone by 10.30, as opposed to entering for breakfast no later than 10.30 they should make that clear. The gentleman dealing with us said that we could "have another half an hour" which was nice however I really felt that the hotel's approach was out of line and unlike my other experiences at other places over the years. I didn't really get to see everything that they had for breakfast as we were too busy wolfing any food down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not as advertise on the web”
Reviews.Author: Visuth V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park Hotel on May 1st thru May 4th of this year.  The room which I reserved and paid for through a travel agency in Thailand was a "Premier Room" for three persons.   First of all, the hotel is in a good location.  Very convenience to walk to MTR (Tsim Sha Tsui), right next to bus stops on both sides of the hotel.  Shops and restaurants are everywhere.  The room was a big size room with two double beds and a rollaway.  With the three beds, there were still plenty of room to walk around.  About 1.5 meter between the end of the bed and the drawer on the opposite wall.  For me the bed was fine, for my back problem I need a firm bed.  The rest room was big enough with separate tub and shower.  The air condition works fine not like most hotels in Singapore, where it gets to be very cold even if I turned it off. Overall, the room was excellent. Now, for what I want to complain about. I found this hotel  on the net.  After looking through the information, I decided that I want the "Premier Room" because of the size.  It should work fine for 3 people. I WAS WILLING TO PAY FOR THE COST.      AND I DID. The following were information given for the "Premier Room" on the net. Premier Room The exquisite 40 to 45sqm Premier Room offers a serene oasis atop the bustling city. The luxury of space is evident from the well-defined living and work areas and ample functional space. Revel and relax against a palette of sublime earth tones complemented with dark wood to create an inviting contemporary atmosphere. Each Premier Room offers stunning views of the city or of the lush neighbouring park. Business travellers may take pleasure in the large working desk and a multi-function fax machine allowing you to work in the comfort and privacy of your own room. Alternatively, relax your senses with a gratifying soak in the spacious bathroom with a separate shower and deep soaking tub. The Premier Room is available in King-sized, Queen-sized or twin-bed categories. • Complimentary high speed Internet access for one device • Complimentary buffet breakfast for one • Complimentary mini-bar refreshments with daily replenishment • 1.5 hours free standard drink at Marigold Bar • Complimentary local calls • Complimentary laundry for one suit per stay • 20% off laundry and dry-cleaning services • 25% off food and beverage bill • 20% off service charge of IDD calls • Complimentary late check-out till 6.00pm (subject to availability) • Multi-function fax machine • Coffee and tea-making facilities • Personal safe • Hairdryer • Complimentary water • Room service • Free usage of the conference room for up to two hours (per stay) (subject to availability) • Welcome fruit upon arrival 40 to 45sqm – city or park view – high floors – complimentary high speed Internet access – multi-function fax machine – mini bar – coffee and tea-making facilities – personal safe – hairdryer – separate shower and deep soaking tub – welcome fruit platter However, when I checked-in, I was given the 6th floor and 90% of the complimentary were not comply.   NO.             • Complimentary high speed Internet access for one device NO.             • Complimentary buffet breakfast for one NO.             • Complimentary mini-bar refreshments with daily replenishment DON'T KNOW           • 1.5 hours free standard drink at Marigold Bar DON'T KNOW.          • Complimentary local calls NO.             • Complimentary laundry for one suit per stay NO.             • 20% off laundry and dry-cleaning services NO.             • 25% off food and beverage bill DON'T KNOW            • 20% off service charge of IDD calls NO.             • Complimentary late check-out till 6.00pm (subject to availability) NO.             • Multi-function fax machine NO.            • Free usage of the conference room for up to two hours (per stay) (subject to availability) NO.            • Welcome fruit upon arrival YES.          • Coffee and tea-making facilities YES.          • Personal safe YES.          • Hairdryer YES.          • Complimentary water YES.          • Room service So, I got just the Deluxe Room service at the price of a Premire Room. The check-in staff informed me that the "Premier Room"'s complimentary which I didn't get were for "Package" reservation.   PACKAGE RESERVATION ???         What PACKAGE RESERVATION ? There was no mention about the PACKAGE RESERVATION in the net.   And even if there were, I paid for 3 nights stay  isn't that "package" enough. I WROTE THE ABOVE COMMENT TO THE HOTEL YESTERDAY. HAVEN'T GET ANY RESPONSE BACK YET. WONDER IF I EVER WIIL ???

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: After reading through TripAdvisor reviews we were pleasantly surprised - or perhaps relieved - at the quality of the hotel and service. We spent our days out and about, and the hotel was a good place to crash at the end of the day The room was clean and large enough for three adults, though the decor needs an update. Housekeeping/room service staff were very friendly and helpful, bit didn't speak much English. Location of the hotel made it easy to get around Kowloon on foot. Lots of good cafes and restaurants nearby, as well as a couple of cheap bakeries for a quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: anitah
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel in Hong Kong is overrated. The hotel is a basic, 3-star hotel by any standards. Access to the main entrance is through an alley while the side entrance, the most used by guests, is small and lost in a collection of store fronts. The lobby is small with an even smaller bar. The room we were given was a tiny triangular-shaped room where we had to move chairs in order to get in the bed on the side near the windows. The bath was so small that we had to almost sit on the toilet to close the bathroom door!! Our companions had a larger room with a tiny window that looked directly into a deteriorating apartment building. No fitness facilities or pool. The "business center" consisted of two extremely slow computers in a tiny room. The best thing about the hotel was its convenient location. No one from our group would return to this hotel when there are so many other options for a minimal increase in price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service all round”
Reviews.Author: choong1948
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is centrally located at the junction of Cameron Rd. and Chattham Rd. South and is a walking distance to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station along Cameron Rd. The Airport bus A21 bus stop is at the corner of the hotel at Chatham Rd. South. And it cost HK33/- from the airport to the hotel. All the staff that I came in contact are very friendly and helpful. I was able to extend my checkout time to 2 pm on request. On our return we walked over to the other side of Chatham RD. South at Toyo Mall and take the A21 bus to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: yeongml
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong hotels, especially the lower category ones, are famous for their tiny rooms. Well, check out the Park Hotel Hong Kong. Stayed in a deluxe room for three nights. Room was roomy. It even had space for a couch and coffee table. There was a nook with a table and chair. The furniture is nothing to shout about. Wooden, dark coloured closet, bed, chairs, tables. Nothing fanciful but enough. Complimentary drinking water, replenished daily. Toiletries are adequate. No separate shower but there is a bathtub. Housekeeping is efficient and staff polite and friendly. Read some reviews that mentioned smell of cigarette smoke, even in non-smoking rooms. I took a non-smoking room and had no problems with the air. All this comes at a reasonable room rate. There are hotels in Hong Kong that have smaller rooms but with higher rates. View from window: It looks into other buildings. No skyline. Check-in was efficient and pleasant enough. Did not eat in the hotel, so no comment. But Internet access at the business centre is costly. Location of the hotel is second to none if you want to be in the middle of it all. Bright lights, shops, malls, restaurants, transport (bus and MTR) all within walking distance. Busy, busy, busy. The facade of the hotel looks nothing like the one shown on its website. It has been renovated and the main entrance does not open to Chatham Rd South but is at the "back' now, at Granville Circuit. There is a side entrance/exit that opens to Cameron Road at the "side". This is closed at midnight. An observation though. The side entrance is open 6am to midnight and people can walk in and out, whether they are guests or not. And the lifts to the rooms are near the side entrance. So anyone can take the lifts and gain access to any floor. There are cameras and the concierge desk is near the lifts but sometimes the staff are busy and they cannot keep an eye on those who come in from the side entrance. Perhaps something can be done to enhance security, like using access cards in order to take the lifts to the room floors. A bonus: King's Lodge restaurant is a few steps away from the hotel. It's popular and serves good food. For a hotel with spacious rooms that come with below-average rates, you cannot go wrong with Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location fine but....”
Reviews.Author: holidaysforus
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel fine for shops, restaurants and the ferry terminal. Decor very tired. Paid extra for breakfast but staff had to be reminded that residents were eligible for 25% off the bill. You need to specify either smoking or non smoking room - we had the former and didn't see the note that said they would change your room if you wanted until we had unpacked. Room and corridor did smell strongly of nicotine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10Lynn
Reviews.Content: Had stay twice in this hotel, basically had nice & clean rooms. Good service from the hotel. Location wise is near to the airport bus. Walking distance to DFS and also many shopping malls in TST. There are many nice food chain around the hotel and is only 3 min walk to TST MTR. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but fire alarms disturbing”
Reviews.Author: TheSanski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The location is great, value for pricr ok, rooms ok, bakfast buffet ok. The major aanoyance was that during both nights the fire alarm went on at 4:30 am, and it was a false alarm caused by hot steam coming from someone's shower(???). Waking up at that time for fire alarm is not nice, and you can just not ignore the alarms. They should really fix that problem.

Reviews.Title: “No I don't want to buy a suit...for the fifteenth time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stressman101
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were more than adequate and check-in/check-out were dealt with promptly and without incident. Stayed here to experience the "Kowloon" side of Hong Kong for four nights and we basically "got what we paid for". Slightly run down with the stale smell of cigarette smoke that was unsuccessfully masked by a sickly sweet air freshner on what was a non smoking floor (so we were told by reception). The "western" food of the breakfast buffet is still very "eastern" and this takes a bit of getting used to. For example...would like to see more than dragonfruit and watermelon as the ONLY fresh fruit choices and also bacon that is not paper thin cured ham with a very bland "wok fried" taste. More than half of the "hot food" on the "western buffet" was either overcooked, undercooked or not at temperature (hotter than 60 degrees) fit for serving. My MAIN BEEF about this place is not actually with the hotel, but more to do with where it is situated...the hotel foyer opens onto a pedestrian crossing that for 18 hours a day is frequented by touters trying to sell western tourists suits, blouses and tailor made clothing. It wouldn't have been so bad if it wasn't THE SAME two people asking the same question to the same western person (Me) every time I came or went from the hotel for the entire duration of my stay. There were two other "small" issues (once again that are not entirely the fault of the hotel...but need to be mentioned as part of an unbiased review) 1. A local cab driver parked in the designated TAXI area for this hotel refused to take us to the China Ferry terminal as he was waiting for a "better fare". The reception staff did NOTHING to report this driver (after I specifically asked them to do so because it is against the law in Hong Kong for a Taxi driver to do this) and also 2. My wife and I were approached in the corridor of the 7th floor as we were returning to our room for the night at a fraction after midnight asking us if we would like a "special mass-ar-gee" as they had just finished in the room beside ours... If you can handle the sort of things I have mentioned in this review then this place is for you and is a reasonable four star kind of hotel (just). If not, then with the super efficient MTR and bus network, stay on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Transit to Australia”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsue
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel on our way to Australia. It was good value for money and the room was large, very clean and comfortable, and ideally located for everything in Hong Kong. The breakfast was fine and the food for the evening meal was a very wide ranging buffet. The only downside was that it was largely seafood, which was fine , but it was widely advertised for to the general Hong Kong public who thronged the place every night to get at the fresh oysters, crab, prawns etc, so for residents to find a seat could be somewhat fraught. Our only other problem was that they refused to accept a VISA Debit card as they claimed it would take 2 months to clear (I've used VISA Debit in India with no problems so was somewhat miffed by this)

Reviews.Title: “great location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: diver1979
Reviews.Content: Great 4* hotel in kowloon. Minutes from nathan road and star ferry. Surrounded by restaurants and shops. Helpful staff, and very smart and clean rooms. Paid around £280 for 4 nights...special offer with lastminute.com...worth every penny. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and a very decent hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Waipawa
Reviews.Content: Had a day stay at this hotel on the way back to the UK. Extremely nice hotel and ideally located for shopping in Nathan Road and close to the Harbour Front and shopping malls. We were upgraded FOC to a deluxe room which in effect was a one bedroom apartment. Clean, spacious, well kept and without question will stay here in the future. Did not stay here long enough to comment on staff but in our short stay we did not encounter any major hassle with them. In our view this hotel can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugsPerth
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, decent sized rooms which were modern and clean. Breakfast was good, but the service was average. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Room small but clean , staff and food another story”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirlforever
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel for a week . It does have a good location but it seems there are a lot of other hotels in this area that might have been better. The staff are rude and if you ask the concierge a question they act like it's a big inconvenience , I'm getting a little fed up with it. Breakfast is good , we have it in our package . Do Not Eat an other meals in the hotel , I had unlucky decided to have the lunch buffet , dreadful. The rooms are clean and cheerful. I windows can be opened if you ask for the key ( i get a little fed up with A/C) there is a kettle to make tea. The beds, we have a double , are small and the rooms are tight. Check if Internet is included . If it is , this means one ip address. So if your a family you will be charged per computer !!!! A friend booked this for us from here so I did not get the chance to review before it was booked

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel, the hidden gem in TST?”
Reviews.Author: Wil23low
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is situated very closely to the TST MTR Station and being in the heart of TST, it's easy to get to all the necessary tourist spots closeby for instance the museums, Nathan Road or to watch the Symphony of Lights on the Hong Kong Island. The front desk and concierge staff are friendly and quick with check in/out. Services are speedy and efficient from the housekeeping staff as well. Rooms are well equipped and clean. Only complaints would be the comfort of the room sandals, the non-user-friendly features of the room controls for light, tv, etc, and the comfort of the bed. There is internet using cable but it would be great to have wireless so that we can connect using our portable phone/iPad. Breakfast is well varied with oriental and international selections. Being in Hong Kong though, the expectations for dim sums are naturally higher but it could be a slight disappointment seeing the selection in the hotel. Overall, due to the strategic location and the service of the hotel staff, this is highly recommended. However, maybe it's time to catch up with other hotels in terms of the comfort level of the room and wiFi?

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: buddy08438
Reviews.Content: I stayed in park hotel with my wife and son for 4 days in march 2012.the best thing abt this hotel is its location.its near to mtr , ferry terminals, in prime market space and also ten min walking distance to see front. staff is very good and helpful. always ask for room overlooking main road for a good view. rooms are clean. They should add some indian veg. food in there breakfast menu as i have seen many indians during my stay in park

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you are a smoker”
Reviews.Author: Wishlist
Reviews.Content: Four nights in the Park Hotel was enough for us being non smokers. The corridors and rooms smelt of cigarette smoke and our room had an ashtray with matches. The fire alarm went off twice briefly which was enough to make us feel unsettled. The room was on the 14th floor, a deluxe room with two three quarter beds. We asked for a queen or king room but were told our booking didn't specify type of bed. So not their fault. There was a desk with cable for Internet and room wifi but at a cost for both. Two lounge style chairs, flat screen TV with limited channels, two door wardrobe and the bathroom had a shower over a bath with the usual mini products available. The towels (2), one was always thin and the other of slightly better quality. Bed linen was fine but the beds were very hard and again just a doona covering so for me it's always too hot and there was no light blanket in the wardrobe. The air conditioning temperature seemed to be centrally controlled and the in room controls were just low, medium and high. Medium and high were too noisy. Curtains were a bit smelly, but otherwise everything was clean with ample room. Breakfast was included and it was the standard buffet style with hot and cold selections and a chef to cook an omelet. Reception were friendly enough considering the place was always extremely busy. Two bottles of water were supplied complimentary, daily. Would I stay again? Preferably not because of the smoking in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: smithj_12
Reviews.Content: Before I write this review I must compliment the staff on their honesty. We had checked out waiting for our transport and one of the staff came to tell me that my opal ring was found in the room (apparently it had fallen from my luggage). I wouldn't have known until I came to wear it and by then, would have been aboard a ship heading for China. I had read reviews before travelling; as usual reviews varied so went with an open mind. However was quite impressed with all aspects (cleanliness, staff, etc.). Would recommend it to others and would definately stay there again if ever we go to Hong Kong. One point I read from other reviews was that the view from the rooms weren't good and that the rooms were quite small. We found the space quite adequate as we were only there to sleep, it was kept immaculate, and really didn't have a need to look out from the window only at first to see what the view was like.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!!”
Reviews.Author: muskie2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed Park hotel Mar 4-Mar 6,2012. The best thing about Park Hotel is the location. You can go anywhere from this hotel within ten minutes by walk in Tsimshatsui. It is not fancy hotel, but hotel staffs are nice and room was very clean. I am sure I will return to this hotel in my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL STAY WOULD GO BACK AND WITH x3 KIDS!”
Reviews.Author: CATHY P
Reviews.Content: After considering all of the feedback we booked the Park Hotel, Hong Kong. We stayed on our way home from a stay with family in the UK. After a long flight and discussion on how we would get to our hotel with x3 children, 7,10,12 and x6 pieces of luggage after such a long flight. We caught the airexpress/train straight from arrivals where we bought a one off ticket, easy and cheap and clean! After catching a connecting free bus with no help from the grumpy ignorant driver we were dropped outside the hotel across the street from the entrance that wasn't obvious. The bus driver pointed and a helpful porter arrived to take all our 11 items of luggage, taken directly to our rooms. The room was big enough x2 single beds in each and later they brought up a very comfortable and clean fold out bed. As a non smoker i was upset to find the rooms were smoking ones and stank, after complaining realised we hadnt asked for non smoking on the travel agents booking and as they were interconnecting we decided to stay they did offer to move us but to separate floors. After they opened windows the rooms began to air. They were of adequate size and the location was the best, we walked everywhere, taxi however to Mong Kong, Ladies market and Disney(that was awful) the staff were all excellent and couldn't help more! The breakfast was review previously by others as poor to good, with x3 fussy kids the breakfast was superb, continental, freshly cooked pancakes, omlettes, juices, pastry, Chinese. Get free breakfast included prior or it was $770 HK daily. Tsim Tsa Tui tube at the end of road, 500m, KFC, shops and chemists and the best fresh juice bar outside hotel crossing on Chatham Road South. I have recommended to a friend and would stay anytime. A culture shock looking out the window, but hey we were in Hong Kong! Basic rooms but clean! NO POOL, AS RATING INDICATES

Reviews.Title: “hope to return”
Reviews.Author: kenpatSydney
Reviews.Content: great position, good rooms, very good service, very good breakfast. took two rooms feb. 2012.and caused some confusion with our requirements . this was our fault but the staff fixed all with speed and politeness. hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: DurLak
Reviews.Content: 5 mins away frm Tsim sha Tsu mtr and in rhe midst if local stylish shops, the hotel gives you a great advantage. Travel to central, LKF, or Wan Chau is wasy and fast. For indian vegetarian food theres New Sangeet restaurant just opposite at Toyo mall and woodland too! Juice stall bang opp the small gate is a myst hv each morning. Rooms are small and luxury is moderate, but then how long would one be at the hotel room anyway. Staff is helpful too. I would stay thr again if only for the location!

Reviews.Title: “Worth for the space!”
Reviews.Author: NeeNee_Cho
Reviews.Content: As you may notice when you visit Hong Kong, space is almost equal to gold. Tiny restaurant, tiny shoplot and most hotel rooms are tiny. Park Hotel, is the one that provide spacious hotel rooms (I did a comparison on a few hotels online at the sama star rating around the area on the room space). Besides, the hotel has a great location, within walking distance to 2 MTR lines entrance. If you are traveling from the airport, you may take the airport express train and change into the free hotel shuttle bus where it stops right opposite the hotel. If you are traveling with bus, the stop is just 2 blocks away. And not to forget that the hotel has just recently fully renovated, nice modern interior design and clean.

Reviews.Title: “right place for us”
Reviews.Author: asensiblechic
Reviews.Content: My family and i always stay at this hotel for 1 main reason: very accessible to the subway station and shopping places for a decent price. This time though, we were given a room that was not as big as i thought it was. It had 2 twin beds to accomodate my hubby and i with our 2 kids ages 8 and 11. Perhaps its now smaller than i expected because my children have grown. The housekeeping staff was prompt in refills and they accomodate your requests for extra pillows and towels. And that is a big plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DPSun
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe room on a business trip and I must say that the location of this hotel is great, within walking distance to the metro, shopping streets, restaurants, cafes, bars, malls, banks, etc... The staffs are very friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet was good and attentive staff. The deluxe room size was good and the bed was queen size (dont have king size) but that didn’t bother me, the room was clean and well taken care by the Housekeeping. The only down fall was the sound proof in the room was pretty bad, I could not get a good night sleep. I could hear the noise from my neighbor, the corridor, upstairs and the street outside the hotel. The last night of my stay had no sleep, I was wake. Overall, great hotel and location is perfect. I will not hesitate to stay again but would ask for a room with a good proof.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacktwins
Reviews.Content: Room is clean n spacious, staffs are all very attentive, breakfast is acceptable unlike some negative comments from previous review. Only the bed was not tht comfortable, apart from tht, enjoyed the stay n will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: augusta522
Reviews.Content: A great hotel that is close to all transport, museums, ferry terminals. Rooms were clean. All staff, concierge, housekeeping all willing to assist at any time. Service was great. Our third stay here and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: drjoeyksa
Reviews.Content: Stayed last March 2011. Park hotel is an old hotel but is quite charming. Clean rooms and good buffet breakfast. Very good location and staff from front desk to cencierge was extremely friendly and helpful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: mlma1234
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our family in January 2012 for a 2 night stay. Rooms were clean and satisfactory. Located in a busy area and close to main shopping street and nearby subway station. Breakfast was disappointing. Disappointed that WIFI is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Still great 2 years later”
Reviews.Author: booffy
Reviews.Content: Stopped by Hong Kong for several days in December. I decided to stay here again, I wondered whether it would be more dated from my first stay but it wasn't. Hotel was still in tip top condition and still my favourite location because it's so close to the train stations and walking distance to harbour city. Service was fast and brisk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice and clean room”
Reviews.Author: jitkasem
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is located in Tsimshatshui which is very convenient to restaurants and shopping area. Only few minutes walk to MTR Station. You can catch AE from airport and drop off at Kowloonb station. Then catach K4 (every 14 minutes) bus which will take you to the front of the hotel. The room is typically small also same as others in the area. However, the facility is clean and nice. Value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: chuich
Reviews.Content: Short stay here. Wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location and got it! It would have been more expensive to stay in Causeway Bay. Good sized room, don't expect much of a view. We had an extra bed put in which was very uncomfortable. Room didn't smell of roses but ok. Lots of places to eat and shops round the corner. There are two entrances, one closer to food and the other closer to shops. Also a number of banks around the area. All in all adequate for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkonost45
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Rooms are large compared with many hotels in this price range in Hong Kong. Check in was fast and hassle free. Yes, as soon people have pointed out, the lobby is small but this is common in Asia. Room was on 6th floor overlooking Chatham Rd but there was no noticable noise. Everything worked as expected. Internet was no free but this is quite common in Asia and many parts of the world. HK$70 for one hour, HK$120 for 24 hrs, HK$300 for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Navy35
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Park and I would certainly stay here again. The room was well appointed, with a queen size bed, writing desk and full bath and shower (inside the bath). It is located approximately 150 mtrs off Nathan Road, and a 10 - 15 min walk from the Star ferry. TST mrt is located at the end of the street just off Nathan Road. I did not eat at the hotel, but there are many eateries located in the surrounding areas. The only down side I could make of the hotel room was the view. It looked straight onto a roof of another building. But this is only a minor complaint. All in all, I was very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gillydukes77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights (room only) as part of our honeymoon. Medium sized hotel located close to Nathan Road and other central sights, but the location is by no means picturesque compared to others available, but that's probably why it's such good value for money. We didn't eat at the hotel with so many available places to eat in the city. Staff were attentive, rooms serviced every day with free water to keep you hydrated. Mini bar decently priced. Our room smelt quite smoky when we entered it, even though we hadn't booked a smoking room. When we asked if we could smoke in it, they said no problem!! That explained the smell then. Staff were amazing when I got quite sick and called out a doctor to the hotel so I can only thank them for that. All in all, we had a nice stay at this hotel. Rooms and bathroom were clean and tidy, views weren't up to much though. I'd say closer to 3½* rather than 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms can be tiny and people not that friendly. But excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Ce-sky9876
Reviews.Content: We bought superior room and it was very small. No free wifi, no brekky, no hair dryer. But it's situated in a gd location near Kowloon waterfront with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lemongrass_Jt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with Park Hotel. Room is clean and quite spacious. Bed is so so as the queen size bed is made of two single beds combined. Location of hotel is fantastic as there is lots of eatery and shops around the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to the MTR and Harbour City. There is also a DNA mall just beside the hotel..the Mall sells lots of stuff for the teenagers. The hotel staff are also able to recommend the best dim sum restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: bellytastic
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with family. Booked with hotel website and the price is good but as expected with Hong Kong hotels, room was small! No room left after extra bed (which was booked but not in room on arrival) was put in. Bathroom had room only for 1 person at a time. Location is great as its possible to walk to the Stars Avenue within 5 minutes. Another 10 minutes takes you to the Star Ferry Terminal. Hotel is on the corner of 2 very busy streets and traffic noise was a problem - as with Hong Kong - it was all night long!! Access is from a side street and if you dont know which street then you find yourself being dumped on the street from a taxi with your luggage, and trying to negociate across the busy traffic. Would not really want to stay here again but if price is a big issue then its good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: James1London
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel situated in Chatham Road South, Kowloon is well priced and provided a comfortable and well appointed room with King size bed on the 10th floor. 2 nights pre-paid accomodation worked out at 235 Pounds, excluding breakfast. Within 10 minutes walk of the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island the hotel is also well situated for shopping in Kowloon, and is also a short walk from the beautiful gardens off Nathan Street. The staff were very friendly and the hotel restaurant provided a good buffet menu. The Airport bus service stops and starts right outside the front door so travel from and to the International airport was hassle free. The concierge service took care of the baggage and ticket arrangements. My only service criticism was the charge of 70 HK dollars for 1 hour's wifi! Why can't hotels make this service available to guests at no extra charge as it costs very little to provide such a service!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the experience in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fairness07
Reviews.Content: just came back for a 5 days 4 nights stay in this hotel. I have to say that the staff is friendly and responsive. I managed to get a room upgrade and the room is a very good size for twin beds. All in, it was a fantastic stay there and I hope the next time they will provide free wi-free access to the guests!

Reviews.Title: “two types of superior room”
Reviews.Author: thefilipinobulldog
Reviews.Content: Park hotel is great, the location cant be beat, its in the center of everything. What one must see is that there are two types of superior room, one at about 23 sq m and the other at around 35 sqm, so if you are buying from a discount hotel site, you have to realize this. both rooms are great, even the smaller room is cozy but i think the smaller rooms have no bath tub. Service is impeccable, the bellboys are very nice and like to converse with the guests. I requested for a baggage and it was provided promptly. Its near delicious cafe, which has great food and breakfast, and the malls on the other side (mody plaza) has a mcdonalds, and an overrun or surplus shop where you can buy ralph laurens at discount. The best thing about this hotel is the k-4 bus to the airport express station which passes every 15 minutes in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: JonasLin
Reviews.Content: The location of Park Hotel is a place that never bored. Compared to other Hong Kong hotel, the space is quite large. Lots of traditional restaurant nearby. If you are trying to look for a place that more close to Hong Kong night life style, this is the right pace to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: burt6920
Reviews.Content: In fairness to the hotel it had a lot to live up to after during our trip the hotel on hong kong island and khao lak (Thailand) had upgraded our rooms and were both very good hotels. Park hotel did have a lot to live up to and it failed. We were on the 9th floor which I am convinced is a smoking floor. The moment you walk out of the lift there is musty/stale smoke smell. We had room 906 which was at the end. The room was not the biggest but clean. It did however stink of stale smoke. Again in fairness to the hotel we did not complain so they didn't have chance to rectify the problem. We had just got off a very cramped flight from Thailand and all I wanted to do was have a shower. However we were not asked if we were smokers. We were only stopping two nights to break up the flight to the Uk. I suspect that as it was only two nights we were given the crappy room. We didn't need many lights on during the night as directly outside the window was a large neon O from the hotel sign. Pleasant! Breakfast wasn't great. The egg chef needed to smile and learn not to just point. The European items (bacon, sausage, beans etc) we just in bowls and were cold. They did not appear to have free wi fi in any public areas (other hotels did) which I felt let the hotel down. It's free in mcdonalds so why not a 4 star hotel!!! I am sorry park hotel but we won't be coming back. Great location, very close to all the attractions. Try sticky fingers bar. 2 4 1 on most drinks till 10pm which is a welcome site with hong kong bar prices

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: patully
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable hotel. Great location in central Kowloon and not noisy at all. Facilities at this hotel are all that you'll need with a nice restaurant catering for all needs and tastes. Rooms are very spacious, complimentary bottles of water & tea/coffee. Staff are friendly, albeit on check-out I wasn't asked if I had enjoyed my stay (surely a pre-requisite?).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Ivor J
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from October 23rd October. During stay service was good and food in restaurant was of a high standard. Located close to TST Metro and with the new underground walkways it is now possible to avoid the crowded streets and walk most of the way to the Avenue of Stars underground. Lots to see and do locally. The only downside is re check-out. This is at noon and if your flight departs later in the day hotel want a half day expensive rate to keep the room open. Beware if you decide against this that the toilets are key card operated so you have to ask the staff for permission to use them. We saw a couple with young children awaiting their pick-up refused access to the toilets. Not ideal service to departing guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Spacious Rooms, & Great Value in HK”
Reviews.Author: viator1
Reviews.Content: Well run hotel. I found the staff accommodating but slow and aloof at times. I would had given this a 5 dot rating - but they need to step it up just a notch. The rooms were spacious for a HK standard. Room 1105 had a sitting area and a desk area which worked out well since we were partially there for business. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms had a lot of nice little touches with new modern fixtures, and it was impeccably clean. Good breakfast - better on the Western side than the Asian. Better congee than at the BP International. Needs to improve the Asia breakfast offering. HK is a foodie town and the breakfasts at most mid-tier hotels are unremarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Very strategic location also”
Reviews.Author: RohanKhara
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) had booked 5N/6D @ this hotel and this was a great decision. Not just in terms of cost, but overall this hotel ranks high in terms of service, cleanliness and location. Its within a stone's throw of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station and the entire Chatham road is full of life till about 11pm or midnite .. so safe for tourists if they have caught the late train back to their hotel. The service was always very prompt, everyone understood & communicated well in English. Lots of good restaurants around this place (If you want to taste the Indian cuisine, there is a restaurant called Tandoori Nights and Aashirwad which are very closeby and serve scrumptious, lip smacking food). We only had breakfast @ the hotel & they served a decent variety of vegetarian options. Of course, lots more for those who eat eggs, meat, sea-food etc The concierge desk is very knowledgable, courteous and helpful. They also rented us umbrellas on the days it rained. Overall, a great choice and I will strongly recommend staying here and getting a taste of their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in HK standard at a busy location near TST Mtr.”
Reviews.Author: Piscesmommy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites in mid November in this hotel at a very good rate. Hotel is 8-10min walk fm mtr (due to the crowd along the busy narrow path). But surrounded by many restaurants & shops & Mac juz across the street in a shopping mall. Our room hv PArtial view on the harbor on high floor. Room is modern & clean & comfy. Easy assess to harbourfront and many other shopping malls by foot. Recept need to improve their knowledge on public transport though. We had different answers on the shuttle bus services availabilty to Kowloon airport expresstrain station & to Disneyland which is very confusing which we decided to take cab at the end. But bellboy help us get a cab easily fm front door. Overall good for our rates of USD125/nite

Reviews.Title: “Susan from Air Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: AirDelMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel for 2 nights during their 50th anniversary in November 2011.Our stay was absolutely out of this world.All the staff were friendly and helpfull.The rooms were spacious and extemely neat and practically decorated.Most important - it is centrally situated.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family stay”
Reviews.Author: azura_annuar
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights with hubby and 4 kids. agent didnt secure connected rooms but reception lady by name of Maria was kind enough to ensure that 2nd and 3rd nites we had connceted rooms. helped a lot coz kids age range from 2 - 18 years, so i can keep tab on all of them. only thing should consider providing free wifi service. however, love first experience in HK with whole family!

Reviews.Title: “reception a turn off”
Reviews.Author: rajesh v
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and kid in this hotel for 2 nights in OCT. The location is perfect and the rooms are pretty tidy even though a bit small. The worst part was the girls at the front office who keep giggling through out the check in process a definite turn off will appreciate if the management does something about the basic educates of customer service and with just 2 sofas at the reception there was no place to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teri M
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel in June, 2011 for a four night stay Oct 31 - Nov 3. This was our last stop on a tour around the world. My husband was diagnosed with bladder cancer Aug 16 with two imminent surgeries. I immediately tried to cancel our reservation. Their policy is no cancellation and they mean it. Park Hotel refuses to reply to my several attempts of written communication which includes medical documentation. All hotels in five other countries have given refunds; some with a cancellation fee. You have a multitude of choices in Hong Kong, so book elsewhere just in case you also have a medical condition which changes your travel plans. I am very disappointed in their lack of response, although they seem to respond to poor reviews here on TripAdvisor. Will this review get attention???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: DCturbo
Reviews.Content: Great location in East Tsim Sha Tsui if you are looking for a hotel in Kowloon. Near 2 MTR stations and plenty of eateries and shops in the vicinity. For those who prefer soft or soft-medium mattresses ... BEWARE! In spite of requesting for softer mattresses, they mentioned that all rooms are the same!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, room and location”
Reviews.Author: Junkeatarian
Reviews.Content: very clean and comfotable room, nicely done up interiors, very good service and conveient locaiton

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneEssex
Reviews.Content: No longer an International hotel, reasonable location, restaurant staff friendly, rooms on the small side but clean.

Reviews.Title: “2 night trip in HK”
Reviews.Author: Diego S
Reviews.Content: Great location and very elegant rooms for a reasonable price. I've really enjoyed the location and the rooms. The staff was kind and gentle and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: weekendtravelor_10
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel Hong Kong and Park Hotelgroup sinagpore dont seem interested in answering email sent to their POSTED email address. Even Travel Agents unable to get booking confirmations. After nearly one week finaly a booking confirmation arrived. Within one hour another call saying the price quoted was incorrect and that the price would INCREASE again Very poor service indeed, especially since I recommended Park Hotel to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience here”
Reviews.Author: Choppies64
Reviews.Content: Our third say here and we were lucky enough to score a complementary upgrade. Our room was large and as good as any of the 5 star hotels we have stayed in. Good location and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Kowloon side location, clean, comfy and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel143
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 4nts stay here. When checking in, they saw we had a baby and upgraded us to a two-double bed room which meant the room was a little bigger. They were friendly, the rooms were clean, we had a bath, we were situated right in the center of everything it seemed, there is an mtr station two blocks away but we never used it, and the staff were very friendly and efficient my only complaint would be the food. We ordered room service twice and both times the food was lukewarm at best and not too flavorful. Would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarsdenArmagh
Reviews.Content: The location in TST can't be beat. You're a stone's throw from the Peninsula Hotel, the waterfront, and the ferry terminal. Great location for first time visitors to Hong Kong as you can get to everything, but you're in a nice area. The rooms were nice - the place has a feel of a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “General manager's office and admin is a disgrace!!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyWSingapore
Reviews.Content: Horrible communications with the admin offices prior to arrival... all requests ignored and replies from them only when chased repeatedly with pesrsonal phone calls... especially the general manager's office... very rude PA to the GM and shamefully poor English for that level!! I hope their new Singapore property will be better run. Very arrogant and cold receptionists. Heard every flush of toilets in adjoining rooms and incessant traffic below. Receptionist were excruciatingly arrogant and cold. I watched a soft-spoken Japanese man struggle to get a room on a walk-in rate. He was given a lower rate when he called from the airport and by the time he arrived at the hotel the rate went up by HKD80 per night?!! I tried to assist with his being nderstood by them. They just gave him a "take it or leave it" reply...!!! Despicable business practices!!! A crying shame for what could be a great property... No king, no queen... a measly little double bed for 2 persons to sleep in?! Head office... take note please.....!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrFlo77
Reviews.Content: I have a chance to stay at Park Hotel for a night when I was in HK. Quite a weird entrance, at the back of the shop lane. Dont under estimate the room. It’s a 4 star hotel. Clean modern room with hair dryer attached. Room size is quite above average for other similar level hotel . I can say this is spacious hotel in HK. Location wise, it was good, walking distance to TST MTR and Shopping around Granville Rd. Compared to Guandong Hotel, i prefer Guangdong from outside. It was more expensive than Guangdong Hotel. Free Airport transfer (K4) just outside the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Busy and in the Action”
Reviews.Author: Soapy49
Reviews.Content: Location: Cameron St Kowloon, short wark to MTR system, plenty of varried places to eat in area. Full on tourist ansd shopping area, perfumes, watches, cameras and Tailors. Take train from the airport to Kowloon station then no 4 free hotel bus drops you at the front door. Hotel: Very busy, recently renovated, rooms small but with the the required facilities, breakfast excellant with good variety. Staff helpful and polite with room service very good. Tips: Get Oyster card at airport station and you receive discount on cost to hotel. This card covers all types of public transport and can be topped up and 7/11 stores. Cash in balance and deposit at information counter at Kowloon Station when leaving. Getting around Kowloon is easy via various underground station links. Hotel charges for internet use which is unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: iamHunnyBee
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms. Concierge was helpful in dealing with a hotel guest stalker. Best location!
