Walking distance from Nathan and Canton roads, Granville, Kimberley, Symphony of Lights, TST MTR, etc. Disadvantage: I wish they had free WIFI access though. We paid HKD 300 for 7 days of cable internet access, not WIFI. No free breakfast included too. Overall, we had a great experience. Will definitely come back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Blillian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel for four nights on our way home from the UK. Not having been to Hong Kong before, we found the Park in a perfect location for all the attractions and transport. Our room was spotless, the cleaner was even cleaning all the aircon vents one day. The hotel is close to Nathan Rd and walking distance to the ferries and the beautiful city park. Would recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Navigator78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hong Kong last December: it was a strange and great experience. Finding an hotel with a good quality but not too expensive was a little bit difficult also considering that we needed an hotel near the city center (… does Hong Kong has a real city center... maybe not!). because we need to move using buses and subway. We decided to stay in this hotel in Kowloon because it is in a quite strategic position: near the sea (10 minutes walking from Victoria Harbour street), very near to Natan Street and few subway's stations from Temple Street Market. Moreover the hotel is on a secondary street so there is no noise during the night. Due to the small main entrance hidden between shops it is not easy to find it (when the taxi leave us in front of the hotel we weren't sure to be in the right place but after few minutes we identified the hall. The personnel at the reception was very kind and, even if the room wasn’t ready (we arrived very early in the morning) they allowed us to leave our luggage at the concierge in order to start visiting the city. The room was a little bit small but to spend some night in Hong Kong was enough. The bathroom was very small and with no windows. However both the room and the bathroom were very clean and they changed the towels everyday. We had some problem with the WC but calling the reception they solved them very quickly. Breakfast was good and you can eat everything you want: fruit (the dragon fruit was not so good), vegetables, cakes, biscuits, brioches, eggs and bacon… Also the coffee was quite good! At the end I think that Hotel Park Kowloon can be a good place to spend some days in Hong Kong. Some more suggestion for some days in Hong Kong: consider using the multi days Big Bus Tour to visit the city (it is less expensive than using the public transport (especially the subway is very expensive), visit Temple Street Market during the evening (very amazing place where you can buy everything), spend some time walking along Natan Street street and look the jeweller’s shops and the traditional pharmacies. Take a guided tour of Hong Kong Island going to Victoria Peak (where you’ll find the Hong Kong Hard Rock Cafè).

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FlightlessParrot
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a stopover, and it did just fine. It's what you'd expect in this range in Hong Kong: clean, efficient, lots of helpful and cheerful staff. Two things to note. 1. The restaurant is a basic buffet (advertising Australian and Singaporean Sea Food buffet, when we were there). Fine for breakfast, but this is NOT one of the HK hotels that has a magnificent restaurant on the premises. 2. The location is very convenient. It's on a busy corner, but if you go over Chatham Road, there's a large pedestrianised area, with shopping, bars, and eating places ranging from cheap and cheerful to the Regal Hotel, which is world class. It's also convenient to the Museum of Art and the Museum of History, which are both worth a look. So, there's not a lot of character here, but sometimes that's a virtue in a hotel. A good choice if you want to stay in Tsim Sha Tsui, a little way off Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - recommend”
Reviews.Author: blister3304
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights 22nd July onwards We booked a double bedded room and got one! -8th Floor Room was not at all small We did not eat in the hotel - loads of places very close - The Indian just 100m down the road - lunch time buffet - excellent (3rd floor, neon sign outside) proximity to MTR or bus routes an added advantage Check out midday For info - No swimming pool or spa

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Good Location”
Reviews.Author: arunjain22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 3 nights. To start with room was not ready as we arrived very early but it was ok as we went for sightseeing and came back after noon. Best thing i liked about the hotel is staff's attitude always helpful with smile on. location in the middle of everything and about 5 mins walk to TST MTR station. room size is small as all hong kong hotels have small room sizes.Bed was good and comfortable. Overall great in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Sininen
Reviews.Content: Visited HK for the first time and did not really know what to expect. Therefore we spent awful lot of time choosing the hotel. We read hundreds of reviews on the internet, compared the prices, studied the map, and really had difficult time making our mind where we want to stay and how much we are ready to pay. But it was time well spent since we made a good choice and thoroughly enjoyed our seven nights stay at the Park Hotel. Location was good, busy area but not overcrowded. Shopping area and lots of restaurants and cafes close by. MTR stations within walking distance - East Tsim Sha Tsui 5 min and Tsim Sha Tsui 10 min, and bus stops right outside. Easy access to the airport either by train and hotel shuttle bus, or airport bus. Even taxi did not cost much. We got free upgrade to deluxe twin-room. Great room, clean and tidy, spacious with two large beds, desk and small sitting area, good size bathroom. Surprisingly the room looked exactly the same as the photos in the hotel website. Even though only in the 7th floor and facing busy side street it was quiet and hardly any sounds of traffic. My travel companion found the bed very hard but for me it was perfect. TV had several English language news channels of which two local so it was easy to follow the news in case something major should happen that would affect travelling. Two complimentary water bottles per day were nice so we did not need to carry them from the shops. We did not use the hotel restaurant and had breakfast at McDonalds or Starbucks on the other side of the road. Hotel reception worked quickly and efficiently. When in HK I would definitely stay in Kowloon and not HK Island, mainly because for a tourist Kowloon has more to offer in the evenings. Also, from the traffic point of view Kowloon is easier since at HK Island streets are most of the time really slow. I could stay in this hotel again but would also be tempted to try the 5-star hotels in the area if could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: ayuz9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriends for 5 nights and I have no complaints about this hotel. The rooms are spacious and location is perfect, just about 5-10mins walk to one of the entrance to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. There are a lot of shops nearby the hotel, we shopped around the area till midnight, and it was safe for us girls to walk back to the hotel. We went to Macau on our 2nd day, and kept our luggages at the hotel. They have a service to keep the luggages, sorry I can't remember the rate but it wasn't expensive. Based on previous reviews in Tripadvisor, yeap the main entrance is totally hidden from the main road. but they have another door at Cameron road which we used most of the time. Public transport is not a problem. For muslims, u can just walk down cameron road and u'll find Kowloon mosque. There are Halal restaurants near that area. Overall, I totally recommend this hotel to anyone who's going to HK :)

Reviews.Title: “A Very Disappointed stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lavender_Tea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel before and love it's location & the free room upgrade that they have given to us last year November. We were back again from 17 to 21 June 11. This time round, it was a hell for us. We were given room 625 and first night, everything was ok. To be kind to earth, I've chosen not to change our bedspread after the first night. On the 2nd night, my daughter complained of some rashes on her legs & hands and we thought it's time to change the bedspread.....and so we put in our request. The rashes on my daughter didn't go away and there were more after the 3rd night, and we confirmed she was bitten by bed bugs. My hubby & I were free from the bugs and apparently these bugs will confine to a certain area on the bedding and not spreading to the whole mattress. So my poor daughter who has been sleeping in the same side of the bed since first night was the only one being attacked. Immediately the next morning (last night of our stay), I reported to the housekeeping lady who was cleaning in the room beside us, about the incident. She offered to give us additional bedspread to cover the bed headboard just in case the bugs were from the wooden headboard and to clean our room thoroughly. Midday, we called up the hotel in the midst of our sightseeing to request to change room just to be on the safe end but they claimed that the hotel was full house. However, they offer to change our beds. The same night, I was sitting on the bed watching TV show and felt something biting my under thigh, I quickly got up and caught a bug right on the spot, killed it and blood could be seen :( It's only when I got back home to visit the doctor that I knew it was a bed bug. Since it's our final night, we didn't want to go through the hassle to change room or beddings (we have given the hotel the benefit of doubt that they have changed our beds). My hubby slept on the usual spot that my daughter has slept for the past few nights and we have shifted our beds away from the headboard to be double sure. And thank god my husband was free from bug attacked. BUT the horror didn't end here, while I was packing my luggage ready for check-out, I saw a bed bug crawling on my luggage, YUCKS! Again I wiped it OFF immediately. I believe the bugs are everywhere in the room even on the carpet otherwise the little parasite wouldn't have crawled onto my luggage. We brought our daughter to the doctor immediately upon reaching home and I'm now in the midst of disinfecting my luggages. It was indeed a disappointed & stressful stay in Park Hotel! Especially for my poor girl who has suffered so much. It was a nightmare to have stayed in room 625! Yes, I will not stay at the PARK HOTEL again. Bed bugs in hotel beds is the last thing we have on our itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and we will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: GaneshRauniyar
Reviews.Content: Clean and confortable rooms, good food within the hotel and around the hotel ranging from cheap to high value restaurants. Easy walking distance to shops and local attractions. Staff are not that helpful though. You can take bus A21 from the airport anf get off at Stop 17 just infront of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, freshly renovated.”
Reviews.Author: anabugs
Reviews.Content: Nice, little hotel in good location in Kowloon. Nothing fancy, but really clean and comfortable and with all the basic commodities one expects with a good quality hotel. I recently stayed there with my husband for our honeymoon, and all in all the hotel was perfect for us except for the fact that there is no WiFi in the rooms and the only internet was in the small business center downstairs for a price that seemed a bit excessive. 5 min walk to the subway, so it's really easy to get anywhere in Hong Kong within minutes, and if you're looking to stay shopping in Kowloon it is only a short walk from the best places. There is a delicious juice stand right in front of the hotel entrance that makes all kinds of juices, so that was also a plus for me as we did not have the breakfast included. Also, for any young women who love to shop, there is a fantastic little ally right in front of the backside entrance of the hotel, by the bar. You would think nothing of the tiny, kind of dirty looking entrance, but inside there are 5 floors or awesome tiny little stores arranged in a sort of circular maze, with amazing, super original clothes for pretty good prices. A lot of the clothes are from local fashion designers, which make it all the more interesting. Not to be missed for any fashion lover!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel with Excellent Attitude :)”
Reviews.Author: Geogroxs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girls, aged 14 and 9 from 1 to 3 June 2011. Our comments on the following: 1. Staff and Service 1.1 The checking in was a breeze. Kat attended to us. We booked the hotel through www.priceline.com.sg 1.2 The staff generally speak excellent English. There may be 1-2 porters who are not fluent in English but they made an effort to redirect you to an English speaking staff,. 1.3 the Concerige was extremely helpful. We wanted to visit an obscure restaruant. The Staff , Castor, took an extra mile to locate the place, called the restaurant, gave excellent directions. 1.4 We left our luggage with Park Hotel as we needed to go Macau for a few days. The luggage was safe and intact upon our return. 1.5 On our checking out, without prompting, Jimmy, offered to dialed a cab for us. 2. Room 2.1 We stayed in a double deluxe bed room 2.2 The room and the carpet was clean. it was NOT dusty at all. 2.3 The cleaners did an excellent job in cleaning the room daily.

Reviews.Title: “great location...”
Reviews.Author: parochat
Reviews.Content: The great part is the location ..in tsimshatsui , which is the most 'happening' areas in hong kong ...restaurants abound to fit every palate so food is not an issue ...but the hotel itself ? well we went in a group of 5 , my husband, kids and mom in law ..and the good part was the interconnected rooms but if you are travelling with kids ...this is a no frills , very corporate hotel so if you want some milk heated at 10 pm , be prepared to be greeted with a no !...breakfast was monotonous with hardly any variation ...but the rooms are large by hk standards and travelling is a breeze since the mtr , bus and taxis are literally around the corner ..

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i stayed in so far....”
Reviews.Author: its_mitul
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i stayed in so far, i had gone for business and loved the location of the hotel. It is centrally located in tst and has all the places around for shopping and restaurants. The hotel has a great ambience and i had booked well in advance so got a great deal else slightly expensive. The hotel has excellent service and i would recommend the same to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rahul_jain6
Reviews.Content: Last september, I was on a business trip. Excellent hotel, very convenient to MTR, walking distance to famous mall, night markets, nathan road, restaurants and bus stations. Their staffs were also very accommodating. I always recommended this hotel to my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: amytom_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of our Honeymoon. Our travel agent had let them know it was out honeymoon and the hotel had upgraded us to a suite on the 13th floor which had a brilliant view of the city. The room was big and spacious and verly clean and modern. They provide a mini bar but also free bottled water in the room each day along with free tea and coffee. The hotel was a 5 min walk to a main tube station which ment we had very easy access to the rest of Hong Kong and there are also so many good bars and restaurants within walking distance. It was very easy to get there from the airport too - by getting the airport shuttle and a free bus which departed every 10 mins so this also made it very easy to get back to the airport. Everyone in Hong Kong is so helpful that getting around is so not difficult at all. The hotel staff were also very helpful and friendly and were happy to help with any queries we had -We would definitaly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Hong Kong on a siteseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Santanu76
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel in Hong Kong is at an excellent location - a 5 minutes walk from the Tsim Tsa Shui station. The staff is very courteous, prompt and helpful. However, the hotel is not top draw, but average - the rooms are on the smaller side and the food is okay. However, there are numerous food options just outside and the hotel is good value for money, given the location. Would stay here again as a convenient, reasonably priced option - The Sushi restaurant on the opposite foot is great - so is the Charlie Brown and the various foot massage and shopping options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pennae
Reviews.Content: We booked a good deal with AirAsiaGo and were mentally prepared for a pretty ordinary room. Weren't we surprised! In a good way! The room was bigger than we had expected (plenty of room for two in the twin) and had recently been refurbished with a great TV, nice carpet, spotless bathroom, etc. The room wasn't a 4* or 5* "chain hotel" standard but it was great for Hong Kong, and great for the price. Breakfast is a bit "blah" - we ended up eating out 2 mornings out of 4. All of the elements are there (egg station, cereal, hot and cold choices etc.) but it's not well cooked and is very, very average. The concierge was really helpful; the hotel's in a great spot for shopping and the MTR's; and it's a nice walk either through the underground or above-ground to the Star Ferry et al. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: meme_melody
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Convenient. Check in was smooth when we check in at 11 plus in the morning. Rooms are spacious for 3 adults plus our luggages. Eateries are just steps away. Shops are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for tourists & shopping”
Reviews.Author: cactuslw
Reviews.Content: The location of Park Hotel is superb. It is right among the bursty shops in Tsim Sha Tsui area, within walking distance from MTR stations and the Star Ferry Pier, and very close to the Museum of History / Avenue of the Stars / harbor. The shops and restaurants in Tsim Sha Tsui area do not close till midnight (but they open late in the morning as well), so staying in the center of it gave the convenience of sightseeing during daytime and shopping at night. We have been told that hotel rooms in HK would be on the small side, but the room we got in the Park hotel exceeded our expectation. It was spacious, clean, and the furnitures were new and comfy. We had a room facing Granville Rd, so it does not have view, but it was very quite at night. The queen bed in the room was a tad small, but except that we were satisfied to have a big enough room to put all our luggage / have some tea / take some nice rest without feeling cramped. The weather in Hong Kong is quite hot and humid, so the daily complimentary water turned out to be helpful, and so are the hotel crews. We had very smooth stay there and enjoyed a lot. The only complaint would be the internet service. For 100HKD/hour per machine, the speed we got was excruciatingly slow. Furthermore, there was no hotspot in the lobby. In a city where you start to get free hotspot connection at bus stops and everybody uses smartphone, this aspect of the hotel was kinda antiquated. Some tips * The airport bus A21 stops right next to the hotel, and there is FREE wifi connection on the bus * The fruit shop across the street sells good mango sago and coconut sago * It is possible to borrow power chord convertor from the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good...”
Reviews.Author: SandraB1962
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty finding reasonably priced accommodation in Hong Kong and having read the various reviews in TripAdvisor, decided to take the plunge and book direct with the hotel. Good, central location with great, decent-sized rooms, well decorated, which is not always the case in HKG, good service - absolutely no complaints. This is a good find for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: moneyshot807
Reviews.Content: Upside: great location in Kowloon. Very clean rooms with comfortable beds. Easy to get to-and-from airport (bus A21 stops outfront). Downside: a little expensive. Internet prices were a rip-off. The concierge gave bad advice about airport shuttle (tried to sell me on something that coast nearly 3 times what public transit costs, and which takes longer to get to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Loud air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: GGlen78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and 2-year old daughter. Check-in was smooth enough. Reception promised to deliver the cot within 30 mins. It took 2 hours after we reminded them. Rooms are insulated from the city noise, but the air-conditioning is far too noisy. We decided not to book the rooms with breakfast included - a wise decision in retrospect, as there is a Charlie Brown cafe opposite the hotel Cameron Road entrance which serves excellent, reasonably-priced Western-style breakfasts. Location is excellent- Within walking distance to the Star Ferry, and there is an airport bus that stops outside the hotel every 12 mins that takes one to Kowloon Railway Station. Beware to check when you book if the price includes the 10% service charge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Clean, great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nvls
Reviews.Content: The exterior and lobby don't look much but the rooms are really big, modern looking and clean. The controls in the room are electronic, there's lots of storage and friendly staff. Bottled water is complimentary. It's very near watsons, park and shop, yoshinoya,, mcdonalds, miramar mall, mtr station, nathan road and 10 min walk to ocean terminal. The drawback is internet isn't free and the bfast buffet didn't look or taste appetizing. The waffles were hard like bricks. Local calls aren't free. We got the room at 1210hkd a night, which is really reasonable for the location, quality and size of the room. It can comfortably fit a family of 4, with ample room for luggage and bags. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelcharm06
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel last week. It was a good choice that we booked in this hotel because the staffs are courteous and helpful. The room is spacious based on HK standards and everyday they make up our room even without a request to do so and they provide two (2) complimentary bottled water everyday if consumed. The location cannot be beaten off as the hotel is only less than 10 mins walk to Nathan Road and to Entrance/Exit B2 MTR and in front of that MTR are fast food chains like Mc Donald, Burger King and KFC. There are also many restaurants, cafes, shops nearby the hotel and there is also 7/11 near to it. The Avenue of Stars, Ferry Terminal and China Ferry Terminal going to Macau are only 15 to 20 mins walk or 5-10 mins taxi ride for only 20-25 HKD. NOTE: If you plan to ride a taxi in HK make sure you have a map with a Cantonese version to the destinations where you want to go because, as many if not all taxi drivers hardly speak and understand English.

Reviews.Title: “Most Recommended Hotel To Stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Caiden
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is centrally situated in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. It is a few minutes walk from the MTR that takes you around Hong Kong to visit all the major attractions. The hotel is also close to the Avenue of Stars and The Harbour. The hotel provides excellent service, extremely friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast at the hotel is simply fantastic and delicious. Great Amenities in the room which include, free tea & coffee and a T.V. The room was comfortable and cosy. The wake up calls were prompt. I would highly recommend this fantastic hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: bamitch
Reviews.Content: We had a double deluxe room which was quite spacious and clean. Staff were friendly and the location of the hotel is in walking distance to temple st markets, nathan st, harbour and great restaurants. Nice stay

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: zuheb
Reviews.Content: Park hotel is located right in the heart of Bustling Tsim tsa Tsui ..which makes it very convenient to access all major attractions..as you step your foot outside you are in shoppers paradise.. though we travelled for business and were just using the room to sleep at night but still we can say it was very comfortable, rooms are spacious and clean

Reviews.Title: “child unfreindly”
Reviews.Author: weekendtravelor_10
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel doesnt allow children ,age 2 and 3 , in same room as parents and with no extra bed without paying, they insist maximum is 3 per room regardless of age. stay away from Park if you have kids

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BASE FOR EXPLORING HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: FOXY44Cheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my way back from Australia for a four night stopover. My husband, 4 year old son and 70+ year old mother-in-law were with me. At first glance, the hotel was a bit disappointing but once we were shown to our rooms our disappointment was relieved. The rooms were nice and clean, quite small but adequate. My only problem was that our son was expected to stay in our bed with us! Not a major problem as we were only here for a few days and he is only small but beware of this as it was not what we had expected. The breakfast was excellent - all the normal things you would expect - cereal, toast, cooked stuff, etc, plus, of course, the Asian twist of rice/miso soup and other such oriental things which we didn't try but they looked ok. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location - close to Nathan Road and the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tminperth
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Hong Kong before and this was a great introduction. There wer no problems checking in, the staff spoke excellent Enlish. We had adjoining rooms which were very large, well fitted out and in good condition, the facilities in the room were very good. Location wise, we were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go, the subway was close by. The only draw back for us - with two vegetarians on board - was that the hotel restaurant had a limited menu for vegetarians BUT there were plenty of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weel Priced Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Codes
Reviews.Content: Is a nice hotel and has everything you would expect or need for a few days stay in Hong Kong as is well priced and in a location which you can walk to everything from. Also offers the bonus of having a rail bus which stops directly outside which takes you to the airport train. Need to double check when arriving from the airport train bus that you are on the right bus as it looks like they just changed which colour bus goes to the Hotel as the guide we were given at the airport send the wrong colour line. Also a tip if you are looking for a good meal try going to what the locals call the STEPS

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Top Location for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy69Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at Park Hotel in one of their deluxe rooms. Room modern but on the small side. But from reading forums here that is not unusual. This hotel would suit business traveller. Were you need central location close to MTR station, Star Ferry, Shopping and Night Life. The breakfast was a little bit "same same" but was still good. Staff are friendly and helpfull. I would stay here again if in Hong Kong on business.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant place and staff”
Reviews.Author: MickLeeds
Reviews.Content: Caught up in the snow at Heathrow thanks BAA! Hotel could not have been more helpful knowing I was to arrive 2 days late. No charge made and the service whilst there was excellent. Just wished I would have had more time there but had to catch connecting flight 2 days later Location perfect for exploring Kowloon and for star ferry over to HK island. Overall a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: kcchong
Reviews.Content: Likes: Great location (less than 5 minutes walk from TST MTR Station), value for money (considering the size of the room), very responsible staff (especially the manager: Andy - thanks for helping us sort out our hotel transfer even though it is Air Asia's fault), clean rooms Dislikes: No free internet (HKD120.00 for 24 hours), breakfast spread is not fantastic Overall: Would definitely come here again - again what matters in HK is value for money (HK's hotels are extremely expensive) and location, location, location (right smack in TST area near the MTR)

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent location but quite small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moiz4got
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my trip from hongkong where i stayed for 26th to 31st. Initially i have got a room booked for my family which included my, my wife and my 5 year old son from my local travel agent who had booked through the HOLIDAY WORLD tours agency in hongkong i suppose. when i checked in the staff are not so efficient not their English is very good. after breaking my head on the receiption i finally entered my room and i was shocked. The room was of a not more then 75 - 80 sq. ft where they expected all 3 of us to stay together. Due to the language problem they couldnt understand our problem and i had to finally upgrade my room to a premier room for which i had to pay an extra 10K. Also their breakfast menu is pathetic where for all the days i stayed there we have a the same monotonous menu everyday... This is the first hotel i have visited which does not have a SPA facility inhouse... other then this the location of the hotel is excellent. It is a paradise for shoppers. I also liked it as an apple store , 7 eleven and other store are just next to the hotel. Even big shopping places like bossini, giordano and others are just on the back side of the hotel. If you just walk the full block of the hotel i am sure you fill find everything you want to buy and all at a good price. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Megha_it_is
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of TsimShatShui and is very well connected. The rooms are small but clean and average. The breakfast was very boring and repetitive. You can stay here if visiting Hongkong as it is a good hotel and has a lot of shopping and eating places around to suit all tastes...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: GregandWinnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good spot in downtown Kowloon, a couple of blocks off the main road (Nathan Road). The MTR station is only a few minutes walk away. The airport train shuttle bus stops outside the hotel for drop off and pick up. Our room was quite small, and we think that most of the others on our floor were a bit larger. Having said that though, it was well apointed and more than adequate.The front desk staff and bell boys were all very helpful. The one thing that was not so good was the cost of internet services. They were not cheap for short term usage, and the fact that they were continuous once you started (no log off / log back on function) meant that you wasted a lot of what you paid for. Overall, a good hotel, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good with few flaws”
Reviews.Author: cirque
Reviews.Content: Booking You can get cheaper deal through travel agent rather than direct booking through hotel website, but with few dollars difference only. I book 2 nights few months in advance at rate of HKD834 per night for their lowest room category (room only). Location The hotel is located at the corner of Chatham Road South and Cameron Road. You can find lots of eateries, shops, and other establishments in the area. The nearest MTR is East Tsim Sha Tsui East exit P3 (that's the elevator) or exit P2 (escalator near East TST public transport interchange or Kowloon Shangri-La). You can use the underground walkway to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR or stroll along Cameron Road until exit B2 of TST MTR. The hotel also served directly by Airport Express complimentary shuttle bus K4 from Kowloon MTR Station (bus stop is across the hotel at Cameron Road). Arrival Don't be fooled by the picture. The hotel main entrance is located at Granville Circuit. If you are coming via MTR or Airport Express K4 Shuttle Bus, you will be likely to access the hotel through its Cameron Street Entrance. This entrance is very small, only 2 sliding doors, with shops lining the rest of the ground floor. There is a small sign above the doors and that's all. In many publication, you can see a big Park Hotel sign in the corner of Chatham Road South and Cameron Road, but it's now has turned into huge watch advertisement space. The Cameron Road entrance will direct you to the elevators to every floor and the real lobby is behind it. Check-in Lobby is very small, there are 2 set of sofa, a small cafe, a business center, and concierge (doubled as tour desk and bell service) desk. Not really a 4-star feeling, but more to modern 3-star. Staff that was checking me in was not that hospitable and a little rude. I gave her my booking slip, but she pushed it back and instead asking for passport number. This was the first time I treated that way. I was too lazy to ask for room preferences (since I made a booking via travel agent, asking room preferences were not an option) since the staff has indifferent attitude. She put me in Room 526 on 5th floor (the hotel lobby is on L level, restaurant at 4th, guest rooms from 5th floor onwards). The Room My room was the last in the corridor (it's corner room, but only has 1 window facing Cameron Road). The room has adequate soundproofing. I didn't hear any outside noise (despite it's a busy street down there and I was only in the 5th floor). It was a smoking room, but since it has recently undergone renovation, I smelt no appalling smoke smell at all. Room size is bigger than most Hong Kong standard, adequate for a 4-star property. Internet is not free, but wired line is readily available. Room has 2 single beds (more like large single, but not quite double size, approx 120cm x 200cm each), set of 2-chair and table, writing desk, plasma TV, mini bar (fully stocked), luggage rack, and wardrobe cabinet with in-room safe. Furniture is made of wood with brown black hue. Striped carpet and earth tone wallpaper really brings out the modern feeling of the room. However, some furniture have showing its age (it was painted, so that when some edges scape something, the paint will come out). Not that good for a recently renovated hotel. The Bathroom Bathroom is pretty spacious with toilet, sink, and bathtub/shower combination although the bathtub is not of full adult-size. Bathroom amenities are very generous and well-presented despite using generic hotel supplies (not supplied by certain body care purveyor) - for those who have read about the horror stories of how certain hotel used to refill these things, it's a bad news. 2 complimentary bottles of water are of very generous size (each of 750ml bottle). Overall presentation is flawless, but looking carefully into the details, I found some flaws: There is a hardened fungus mold around the toilet flush. Not good for a newly renovated room. Also, the shower curtain has bad design: only has 1 layer, so if you put the curtain outward (not bordering the tub from inside), water will flood the bathroom floor. Also, the nearest drain is located somewhere near the sink, not very good design. (see photos) Hotel facilities I didn't use any of the hotel facilities, so can't comment on this. But the business center is very small, just consists of cubicles with 2 computers. That's all. Looks uninviting. Even airline lounge has better amenities and space. Room service is - as other hotels - pricey. Security This is where Park Hotel Hongkong really lacks. The hotel is really open to everyone. The elevators to guest rooms are very close to Cameron Road entrance and yet I never saw any security guard patrolling the area (not I'd ever seen any security guard in the hotel), so everyone can walk in freely into the property. Provided they're just having a renovation, not installing a keycard recognition access in the elevator can lessen the secure feeling of its guests. Departure Check-out was swift. Don't bother about reception staff at this time, but bellboy was very courteous. Verdict For the price, it's one of the affordable and value choice at touristy TST area. However, the hotel still needs better care and maintenance if it wants to keep the property in good standing. Also, staff definitely needs more hospitality training on how to treat guests with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms and close to shopping and dining options”
Reviews.Author: eatshopeatshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights here. The hotel entrance was not quite visible from the main shopping streets as its main lobby is behind. Rooms were quite standard and spacious enough for two persons. There is a mouldy smell in the wardrobe cupboard though. Most of the shopping malls were within walking distance of the hotel. We also checked out various restaurants nearby, including Charlie Brown Cafe (western, with a bit of fusion) just opposite the hotel as well as Tao Heung Restaurant (dim sum) nearby. On one of the days when it was raining, we borrowed the umbrellas from the concierge and was told beforehand that we would be charged 80HKD for each umbrella if we did not return, which I thought was quite exorbitant for a normal used umbrella. Probably there were cases of non-return before and hence the high penalty. Nevertheless, we returned our umbrellas promptly. The Airport shuttle bus to Kowloon station stops right outside the side entrance to the hotel which makes it convenient. But do take note this is possibly the 1st stop and one should cater some time for the bus to get to Kowloon station as it makes it way through the next few stops in bustling Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “Good room with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park hotel for 3 nights from 8-11 Nov and really enjoyed our stay. The room is good sized, comfortable and very clean. The hotel provides 2 free bottled water every day. The location is perfect, just 5 mins walk from Tsim Sha Tsui station, exit B2. There are lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again when we come to HK next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Above Average Location & Below Average Prices”
Reviews.Author: jlessner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on three separate occasions in the same week so saw 3 different rooms. Thankfully they got better each time because the first one was quite depressing. The hotel has just come through a major remodel and they did a great job. The facade of the building and its interiors are sleek and modern and of good design. The rooms don't quite fit the same aesthetic but most are pretty good. My 1st room was the size of a shoebox, I mean tiny! Thankfully I was staying for less than 12 hours. Following that tiny room, I received larger rooms. All of them come of with floor-to-ceiling windows and a control panel that controls all the room's functions. Nice and high tech. My only two complaints were the $120 charge for 24hrs of WIRED internet! Crazy! And also the rock solid mattress. I know it's quite common throughout Asia, even preferred, but still I hated it. The staff here is quite helpful and personable which definitely left a good impression on me and the location is quite good as well, but a little east of most of the action. But when you compare this properties rates to those nearby or those on the island, the Park Hotel certainly looks better.

Reviews.Title: “very bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: viral236
Reviews.Content: the location fo this hotel is excellent as its directly on the main street of hongkong.. the rooms are one of the biggest in hong kong and very nice... the rooms are also very comfortable.. the service is also upto the mark and ... the best part is the location but the price is very high according to the hotels nearby..

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bombproofritz
Reviews.Content: Very Good Location for Shopping and Food...Very close to Harbour and Amazing Shopping District Nearby. The Rooms are also reasonably good. Please specify in case you want non-smoking rooms since their smoking floor stinks of tobacco. They were reluctant to change the rooms mentioning that they were full and helpless. Nevertheless they changed one rooms and the second was done later (they gave us twin sharing instead of double) Good Restaurants around Worth Staying overall

Reviews.Title: “Book online and save heaps”
Reviews.Author: SunshineQueeensland
Reviews.Content: When booking online click on promotion tab and a special offer appears if staying for 7 nights. Bonus features include breakfasts, extra bed, free internet, free mini-bar, free happy hour, free laundry. We had a room with 2 queen size beds for the three of us on 14th. floor with a nice view. Always request non-smoking floor as asians are heavy smokers . The Hotel seems to have a lot of mainland chinese as guests as well as Korean. Great location, close to MTR, Airport bus nearby and plenty of eating places and shops. Park Hotel has recently finished a massive renovation which took nearly four years so everything is quite new. Do yourselves a favour and stay there if you can for 7 nights

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not the best...”
Reviews.Author: Bluey99
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Hong Kong for work every year, I usually get booked into the Park - no choice. It is a perfectly reasonable hotel, although I find that the largely Chinese clientele means that the coridors and some of the rooms can stink of tobacco. The rooms are as expected (nothing special), the service is quite good, and the buffet breakfast is good value. The Park's location in Kowloon is reasonably convenient for shopping and not too far from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. It's not a good location for views. If you can pick up a discount internet or travel agent offer for the Park, it is a solid base for touring or working in Hong Kong for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: pappy_28
Reviews.Content: Park hotel is located about 7 minute walk from TST station.. Its easy to find and there are two entrances.. the entrance u reach from TST is the back entrance.. The check in was easy and we were given a room on 7th floor with no real view to speak of.. the room was big with a big bathroom.. no space issues as usually it is in HK.. In fact, we had a extra bed in the room and there was still enough space in the room for 3 people.. we booked a tour to schenzen through the hotel and it was handled well by them.. everyone spoke english at the hotel and they were good at giving directions and telling us what to do.. I tried the TV in the room once and it didnt work or maybe I didnt know how to work it.. but its fine i really didnt want to watch tv.. had the late night buffet at the hotel once and it was nothing home to write about.. It was for 98$ and they gave us 25% off as we were hotel guests.. there were no cards identifying the food so we had a hard time knowing what was what as we did not eat beef..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: L0velyPlanet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park hotel 6 years ago. Since then, this hotel has been completely refurbished for its best. Of course, prices are much higher but it is really worth it. The Park Hotel is now an attractive and modern decorated hotel. It is also very well located, in Kowloon, at a walking distance from ferries, MTR and the famous Nathan Road. There is a free service shuttle stopping just in front of the hotel and going to the train station for the airport. For some reason our DeLuxe room had been upgraded to the DeLuxe Suite and we have been very impressed. Nice view from the huge windows, nice decoration, generous space. A beautiful room perfect to relax after a flight. The 2 beds are a bit too small to sleep 2 persons but we manage with the living room sofa for our child. The breakfast, although not included, is purely amazing. There was so many different, attractive and tasty dishes we could have spend hours eating. Even for a four star hotel, we were impressed. If you have a few days to spend in Hong Kong with a bit of luxury, this hotel is the perfect match.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: patatje
Reviews.Content: At under 100 euro a night, this is great value as accomodation in HK can be quite expensive. Our room was compact but nicely laid out, furniture was still new and it was very clean. It is situated in quite a busy street (which is great) and a few minutes walk from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: MeezerMom
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy lobby but rooms are spacious with comfortable beds. Gave us adjoining rooms for our kids ages 18, 14 and 10. Concierge Jimmy was very knowledgable and helpful, gave us good advice on getting eyeglasses, day trip to China and even got my husband and son last-minute acupuncture appointments. Very friendly and helpful staff. Location is walkable to MTR, shopping, many good restaurants and conveniences nearby.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: pamcos
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights with husband and child 9yrs. Very Good location hotel. Booked a room with 2 beds but bed very small for 2 persons. Did not use restaurant at the hotel, there are a lot of food around - MC Do, Pizza Hut, KFC. we are muslim and did not have problem to eat. The hotel is very well situated, very good shopping specially during that period there were SALES everywhere. Very easy to travel around through the MRT, station not far. We even manage to take the train to Schenzhen. Not to miss in Kong Kong - Disney, Ocean Park, ladies market, shopping in Nathan Road .... but if you plan to go Shenzhen after keep money to shop there.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: BangkokJune
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 2 nights . God location for shopping and just across the street from rise commercial building , one of the coolest shopping buildings in HK but a little far from MTR like 10 mins walk . Clean room smells nice and very nice friendly and attentive staff . will stay here again for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniFirenze
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Park Hotel in June 2010, after searching for the perfect compromise between price and location, we chose this property. Price was 860 HK$ before taxes for a deluxe room. We did not bother with breakfast and went to the awesome Charlie Brown café in front of the hotel. Room and bathroom size were ok, linens were very clean, as well as the rest of the room. Nice flatscreen tv, complimentary water and fruits on arrival. We asked for a room on high floor and we were satisfied with the room given. Location is close to everything, Tsim Tsa Shui MTR station is pretty close and taxis are easy to stop. We tried the Japanese restaurant on the same street and we loved it. Hotel was a good choice, I would go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dundeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the park hotel Kowloon Hong Kong for 4 days and found it to be very comfortable. The room was large and had a good view of the park.While the breakfast was a bit dear the food was excellent. Just a five minute walk to the main shopping street of Nathan road. The staff did not speak very good English , but they were very helpful . The price of the room was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Property - Excellent Service - Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: ayushmanc
Reviews.Content: The property is centrally located in Tsim Sha Sui, brillinat rooms, better than many similar priced hotels. Good food & service.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Spacious and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: YT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Hotel Hong Kong for 5 nights. I booked the bigger Deluxe Double Room through the hotel website. Prior to my arrival, I emailed the hotel to confirm that my request for a king-size bed in a non-smoking room can be granted. I received email confirmation for my request. The room was quite spacious by Hong Kong standard. Room was clean and paid internet was good. Book early and you can enjoy early bird discount. Airport Express free shuttle bus K3 stops right in front of Park Hotel. Overall, the location is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Located ideally for a short stay tourist....”
Reviews.Author: bvsprasanna
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only for a night. The location is just ideal, the tariff is great value and the service cannot be complained. The rooms are spacious for HK standards. A 3 min walk to the MRT and the shopping areas around the hotel are great value for short stay tourists. Only problem we experienced was that the fire alarm went off twice and the hotel guys weren't able to explain why. This created enough panic. They gave reasons like a guest had the bathroom door open and had hot shower (this was at 2.00 AM) but the alarm went off at 9.30 AM again. They weren't able to explain or chose to avoid. One guy came up with a reason saying that it was a non smoking floor and somebody smoked. One night only but sleep and peace lost. Only panic struck as children started crying and were scared. I hated their attitude for this.

Reviews.Title: “Good after a glitch”
Reviews.Author: Stella78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel with my husband mid May. Upon check in even though I had booked a non-smoking room with a double bed I was told that there were no double beds left in non-smoking and that we could either take two single or a smoking room. I explained that I had called a couple days prior to confirm my reservation but it didn't appear that anything could be done and they were a little indifferent about the issue which was frustrating. I was upset because neither option worked for me since I have asthma and because I hadn't seen my husband in 15 weeks. So after speaking in circles for a while I soon realized that they were unable to process my request because they were assuming I wanted to be on the same floor as the other couple we were with. When I told them that it was fine if we were on separate floors and that I had conveyed this to the person on the phone a few days earlier they quickly got us the room we needed which was a very nice room I think in the newly renovated area-floor 13, room 1303. We had a good stay and no more problems after the initial confusion, housekeeping did a nice job (you have to request for bottled water if you want the free ones refilled each day), it was quiet and not a bad view for the area, the bed was comfortable (mattress is firm), and the location was perfect. Everything was within easy walking distance. I enjoyed the hot chocolate in their restaurant-the food was so so but I can't comment on the buffets as I ordered off the menu-wish breakfast had been included in the price. The only thing I would have liked to have had is free internet. It's nice to be at the hotel and be able to get online w/o having to pay $70hk per hour. Also, if we turned off the aircon before going out we noticed that everything seemed damp when coming back to the room, probably because it's so humid outside. Would return in the future but would make sure I have my requests confirmed in writing first.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but a Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VineetChhajer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park hotel, as i wanted to economize my trip to hongkong and Macau. As i was travelling with my 2+ daughter and wife, i had requested for Early check in and king sized bed, but to my displeasure i wasn't offered any, infact i was checked in at 11:30 am and upon check in came another spoiler the size of the room & a (at best) Queen sized room which was very small for the 3 of us to sleep in which we somehow managed to sleep. These were the minuses for me.. as i wasnt looking forward to use any pool or other business services so am not aware of the same. but overall the late checkin & the small room, bathroom and bed were below par for any 4 star hotel which it is supposed to be..!! The pluses, the amenities in the room were all there and the biggest plus was the location as everything seemed nearby, the mtr, good shopping & Indian food were all nearby.. making the hotel likeable. even the Victoria waterfront was about 500 mtrs. and easily walkable to. but all in all the Location made up for the other minuses and the breakfast served at their restauarant was likeable and had decent variety and for the amount charged it looked like a Value pick in hingkong, (as even the 5 stars in kowloon have very small rooms plus not this great a location) So if u want to splurge in Macau like i did by staying in the Venetian 7 gamble then to economize your trip efficiently at a great location, Park Hotel is the place for you. but if u were to splurge and rest, then give Park Hotel a miss..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious rooms, bit pricy for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: Farawayjfk
Reviews.Content: Great Locations, just 5 mins walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. got a two bed deluxe room, spacious for HK standards. two beds were super single so kind of comfortable for two of us and our two little kids. plenty of eating spaces around... esp. recommend 1. Juice street seller opposite the hotel entrance on Cameron road. 2. Charlie Brown from a nice American breakfast .. and the kids love being there too .. service is good too

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kings1617
Reviews.Content: From a very unassuming entrance Park Hotel turned out to be a great choice for a city visit. The room (standard) was modern, very clean and tidy, and a good size. The shower room was immaculate, good supply of toiletries etc. The bed was comfortable, not hard, with lovely bedlinen. There was a mini bar, kettle and hairdrier. Buffet breakfast was excellent, huge choice of Western and Eastern style food, plenty for Veggies, different things were available each day. The late night buffet dinner is excellent value, it was less than £8 a head for residents. Location is good, close to MTR stations, and many places easy to walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: raykewl
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this hotel is very unassuming. Once you stepped inside, however, it all changed. You can tell that this hotel is either new, or newly renovated. The lobby is small, yet modern. The room is easily one of the biggest rooms I've ever had in HK. The location is just superb. 5-10 minutes to Harbour City (Star Ferry) & Avenue of the Stars. 5-10 minutes to the bustling Nathan Road. 5 minutes to Tsim Sha Tsui MRT. Less than 10 minutes to bars and pubs at the end of Carnavorn Rd. I'd say this is the perfect hotel for your Hong Kong 101 where you can just walk to the abovementioned places. Plus, Tsim Sha Tsui MRT is near enough from almost every major places in HK. Mongkok, Causeway Bay, Central, Admiralty, all within 3-4 stops. This hotel is just totally awesome! I'd definitely stay in this hotel on my next visit to HK!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav67
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Park hotel in March 2010 was not totally satisfying. The hospitality was average. Staff at the hotel is not very polite. The hotel doesnt offer much of food for vegetarians.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy with my stay there!”
Reviews.Author: KermitAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Central location, arrived early in the morning and they allowed me to check-in straight away. Which was a huge plus as I hadn't slept on my overnight flight from Kathmandu. Thought room was large for Hong Kong standards. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Shinigami
Reviews.Content: It has a good location, near the shops and the MRT. The staff were very nice and accomodating. The room was amazing. Good value for money too. I wont mind coming back again. =)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jaytara
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the Park Hotel is small, indeed tiny by 5-star norms, its food outlets are limited to a coffee shop and a small but cosy bar next to the lobby, but its rooms are excellent value for money, tastefully appointed, spacious and fully equipped. Service at the front desk, concierge and housekeeping is very prompt and positive. I really wish more hotels would conform to such norms and cut out the needless frills of huge lobbies and a multiplicity of restaurants , which are wasteful ecologically and send the room prices up to obscene levels. Of-course, many corporate travellers don't mind paying high rates to wallow in sybaritic luxury because the bill is paid by the company, but as we all know there is no such thing as a free lunch and such wasteful expenditure is most certainly one of the contributors to the financial debacles that have shamed the corporate world. Well done Park Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: shazzbrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Park Hotel for 2 nights in Feb 2010. It is in an excellent position - close enough to the shops and the centre of everything but also far enough away that it's quiet and peaceful. We got the A21 bus from the airport to directly outside the hotel for $33HK - excellent value and worth the few extra steps it takes at the airport to find the bus. We had breakfast at McDonalds across the street each morning because the hotel breaky is a bit expensive. There are lots of great shops along Cameron Rd where we bought hadnbags, clothes etc. You hardly need to go anywhere other than the immediate vicinity!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: gurms
Reviews.Content: The first thing you realise when you enter your room is how large it is, relative to other Kowloon Tsim Sha Tsui hotel rooms. Everything looks pretty new. The carpeting is chic and the modern, subtle colours help you relax. The pillows are real soft - every guest gets 2 plus a plush cushion. The bathroom could use more lighting but it's nice, large and clean. The hot water blasts are an awesome pick me up in cold HK weather. The hotel's location is great for girls who want to shop - the main hotel entrance is at Granville Circuit, home to lots of little shop selling clothes, shoes and bags. The side entrance at Cameron leads to more shop and some fabulous breakfast spots. It's a short walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Hong kong Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: Jisebellet
Reviews.Content: An ok hotel, but great location. Lots of fast food restaurant around the hotel. Walking distance to the train to get to Disneyland resort. The staff spoke english well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: ashish2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park for four nights in late January '10. Had turned up in the hotel before 9 AM after a night flight, and the reception asked us to wait for an hour after completing the formalities quickly, and after 40 minutes or so, we were in the room. The rooms were spacious & clean. The hotel location was itself very unassuming. Specially the small door on Cameron street. But room quality is very well 4 star category. Even though the beds creaked a bit, the pillows were super soft & plentiful, and the bathroom functional & adequate. The in-room safe was handy. The concierge in the lobby were extremely polite & helpful. Although the view from the room was not that great, the hotel makes this up by offering a fantastic location. Opening on Cameron street, which boasts of innumerable cut-price cosmetic & perfume shops, and an easy 5 minute walk to the Tsim Tsa Shui MTR station. The back gate was seconds away from Granville Road, which had a number of outlets to shop from. The main thoroughfare of Kowloon, Nathan Road was also near to the MTR entry. And with it more boutiques for shopping. And we found SALE signs on almost each of these (thankfully, because shopping in Hong Kong is atleast as expensive as Europe, if not more). For local currency, the Hang Seng branch is your best bet. We got a rate of 7.739 HKD (per USD) minus a charge of $50 HKD (fixed charge for any amount). The branch opens at 9 AM on weekdays, and is located between the TST MTR & the hotel. You can't miss it. There was a post of another reviewer who recommended the fresh fruit juice shop just outside the gate, and I wholly second his view. The Coconut Sago was the best. And other tropical fruits were displayed which we hadn't seen before. Very reasonable prices too ($6-12 only). The "Ireland's potato" shop nearby had Chinese music, but tasty fries. But your best bet would be to stock up in the Park cafe's breakfast. All the fruit you would ever want, and the regular 4-star buffet. The sombre (and portly) Omelette chef "Man" was delightful to look at. But ask him to make your fry a bit well cooked! There were more local food options on the Cameron street, one with delectable ducks displayed by the window, but we couldn't try it (most of the group was vegetarian). My dad however tried the Royal Foot spa down the same road for a foot massage ($148), and was impressed. Travelling anywhere in HK is easy. MTR goes everywhere. And coupled with an Octopus card, you dont have to hunt for change for tickets. Taxis are very reasonably priced too, in case your shopping weary feet wants to take it easy. 4 days went in no time. 1st day for the Ngong Ping cable car (recommend the crystal cabin; great views & shorter lines), the touristy village. Dont miss a visit to the Chopstick gallery shop there. Great for souvenirs. The stairs to Big Buddha were not much of a problem to tackle than first imagined, and the view was great. Then it was time to get some bargains on the Timberland/Samsonite & other stores in the nearby Citygate outlet malls. Travel by MTR on this stretch. Also get a 10% discount coupon from the cable car website before you go. 2nd day was for Ocean Park. Get the MTR to Admiralty, and you cant miss the signs for bus 629 to Ocean Park. Reserve a full day for this park, if you wish to 'do' everything. i cant cover ocean park here, would take too much space. but whatever you do, dont miss the atoll reef. another tip - take your cable car tickets to ocean park to get a 10% discount. 3rd day morning we went to Chi Lin Nunnery & the Nan Lian Garden. The Garden was very impressive & photo worthy, but the monastery will take your breath away. Again a quick MTR stop. We did good use of the nearby Hollywood Plaza mall with some bargains, even though we missed the walking tour of Mongkok & surrounding markets due to lack of time. At 8 in the evening, we trundled to the Avenue of Stars for the symphony of lights show. Overrated attraction, and not worth at all. Better to spend time at TST local market, and to try local food, or at least the great desserts. The last day we took the ferry to Central, and then a taxi to Man Mo temple. A must visit if you've not done a Chinese temple before. Then the utterly crowded & missable tram to Causeway bay to do some more shopping at Times Square mall & the Japanese Sogo store. We still missed a lot of sightseeing in HK, but coming back to the topic, I think Park hotel is a worthy & value place to stay in HK. For easy reach to local ambience, and the service offered, I absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alicejaneLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and found it a perfect base for exploring Hong Kong- particularly Kowloon. The hotel is easy to find and you can get a bus from the airport to outside the hotel really easily. This also gives you a great view of the city for next to nothing. The location is fantastic- ok you don't have harbour views but you pay much less and are only a few roads away. It is right in the hustle of Kowloon, with places to eat right on your doorstep. Also very near the MTR which is really useful. The rooms are nice, not great luxury but extremely comfortable and we were upgraded to a deluxe room (I think there was a mix up with our room booking and they had allocated us a twin). The room was nice and big, everything impeccably clean. No complaints whatsoever about the rooms and common areas. The staff were also extremely helpful and ever so polite. This was in fact mirrored throughout Hong Kong and people would go out of their way to help you. We didn't eat at the hotel but what we loved about Kowloon was that there are so many Chinese authentic places to choose from. Some of the bars near the hotel are also excellent, I had the nicest cocktail I've ever had in one which was like an After Eight! Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel- the staff, location and rooms are great and for this price, I doubt you'll beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in November 2009 during their renovation period and again last weekend. Their renovations are now completed and the lobby is now functional and operating. I enjoyed my stay both times. This is a no-frills hotel with all basic amenities. Price is a little high for the accommodation...the furniture are pretty much IKEA quality. But service is first rate. Although in the heart of very busy streets, inside the bedrooms is surprisingly quiet. The walls are thin though. One night I could clearly hear the guest next door coming in at night, opening the door and putting down his/her stuff. Other than that it was always quiet. Very polite & courteous guests all around who stay here. They don't have room service, but serve buffet breakfasts and dinners, and also a reasonably priced late night buffet from 10:30-11:30pm on Thurs, Fri and Sat nites. No mini-bar, but there's a fridge with sodas and bottled waters in there. THEY ARE NOT FREE!!! Buy your bottled waters at 7-11 down the street. The location of this hotel is awesome if you're here for leisure. You're less than 5 mins walk from the MTR station. Taxis stop by in front all the time. Across the street is the airport shuttle stop. As soon as your walk outside there are bajillion restaurants of all type, Japanese ramen, Korean bbq, tapas and bar, kaiten sushi, Japanese teppayaki, Catonese rice/noodle plates and bbq/roast meat, etc. etc. Around the corner on Chatham road there's a dumping place that has long lines at night, so I assume food there is great. Besides food, down Cameron Road there is a 7/11 and Watson's if you need any basic convenience type stuff or OTC medications. On Cameron Street there are also several cosmetic stores that sell lots and lots of stuff at whole-sale prices, including brand name cosmetic items from Estee Lauder to La Prairie ,and hair care products too. There's a SaSa on the street as well but if you're not a local with an account, the whole sale stores are a much better bargain. Threre are several foot massage places we noticed. The smaller ones look seedy but there are 2 big legit ones nearby: the Royal Foot Spa on Cameron Road, and another one around the corner from the hotel if you walk toward the MTR Station. It's got Japanese writings on its store sign. Both are on second floor from walk-ups. The Royal has a greeter at the entrance on the first floor on the street. We tried both, and definitely prefer the Royal, better more soothing massage technique. At the other one, the foot massages were painful. There are also tons of bars and Cantonese dessert places. Many restaurants and bars are actually on second or third floors of buildings so don't just go buy what you see at eye level. Look up from time to time to find more great fun places. Absolutely do not miss having a cup of fruit or vegetable juice from the juice stand directly across from the hotel's entrance on Cameron Rd. They have one of the best coconut juices I've ever had anywhere in HK. Also next to it is a little stand that sells french fries (with cheese sauce, meat sauce, whatever sauce of your choice), bake potatoes and hot dogs. It's a fun snack and if you got kids they'll love them. Basically, this whole area is like one big amusement park for adult leisure travelers. I'd highly recommend it if you're not traveling for business and don't plan to stay in the hotel much except to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great value.”
Reviews.Author: Choppies64
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on two occasions now and think it is a great hotel. Our room was large, as was the bed. Even though the bathroom was compact, it met all our requirements. We had free wireless internet but only in the lobby. The breakfast is good and we love the location which is close to everything and only a short walk to the MTR. We will stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants a good hotel at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dart69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is safe and clean. the price of the hotel fits mosts budgets. the best part is the hotel has a 7 11, KFC, Macdonalds all within walking distance of the hotel. we had an enjoyable stay though we were on a budget trip. the underground rail is conveniently located and we used the same to take the kids to disney land. we also used the rail network to travel extensively around hongkong. would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean safe hotel at reasonable rates. dont expect 5 star facilities and you wont be dissapointed. would visit again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cireirelfy
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are friendly. Eventhough the cleaning lady does not know how to speak english, when I told her and show my flat iron that needs an adaptor, she was able to give me what I need. The room is big and fits our family of four (two adults and two children). The hotel is walking distance to the shops.

Reviews.Title: “SO LOVELY HOTEL AND SUITE”
Reviews.Author: MONICAJETSILA
Reviews.Content: We choose asia for our vacation for 3 mothns. Our first step in Hong kong We loved hong kong!! Our first stop on our trip, it was better than expected. The journey to the hotel from airport did not take long at all. Hotel was so modern, our room was large and clean, everything was fantastic! We loved room here very nice and modern. We did really appreciated that very much

Reviews.Title: “Quite good until check out”
Reviews.Author: DBorg
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights on a combined business/leisure trip at the Park Hotel. Our room was spacious with a separtate dining and office area, the bed though, was only 160 cm wide and quite hard (as everywhere else in Asia). The location is the best in HK, just minutes away from shops, MTR and restaurants. There are still renovations being done and they start driling rather early in the morning... we also hade the unluck to get the room next to the linen closet so we where woken up 8.00 every morning when the cleaning staff started to scream/talk in the corridor. We did not complain about this so maybe it was our own fault. When we checked out we saw that they hade added 10% service charge per night and 300 HKD per computer for the internet. As we used 2 computers we should pay 600 for the internet. I made a big fuss about this and I can still not understand why you should be charged per computer and not by the room. You could not use more the one computer at the same time so why charge double?? I have never understand service charges in restaurants and hotels, why not include everything in the price so I don't feel cheated when I should pay the bill? They did not remove the charge for the second computer as I wanted, I had to pay 50%. But, all in all, it's a nice hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RedJoker72
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Park Hotel for our Hong Kong trips for over 20 years. The latest refurb has really given the hotel a nice feel. A lot has has changed over the years but a few things remain - the rooms are still very spacious and well appointed and the service is better than ever. Our room was a triple - with 3 adults and all of our luggage it was still spacious and very comfortable. We enjoyed the restaurant and room service which was good value for money and good food. The rooms have tea and coffee making facilities which is brilliant and the amneities in the bathroom are really lovely. We couldn't fault the service or cleanliness at all - and my mum is pretty fussy about those things. The location is fanstastic! Only minutes walk to MTR stations and Nathan Road is just up the road. You are surrounded by shops of all kinds though so your short walk to the main drag might take hours if you stop to shop on the way :o) We would recommend the Park Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: haggis27
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location staff were excellent ,room was very good and most important very clean had 7days at this hotel and could not fault anything will stay there if we go back to hong kong again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Itsfee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Before and I wish I had not listened to a person who recommended the The Kowloon Hotel what a disaster that Hotel Is. I should have listening to my feelings and gone back to the Park. I have always had great service and really central to our needs. Rooms are great and even though they are doing up grades the staff were always helpful. I certainly would recommened the Park Hotel to any one. We Were orignally booked to go back to The Kowloon Hotel and I arranged for my travel agent to change hotels while on holiday - Great move that was...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location and newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: FabulousMom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel numerous times. The last time we visited was last October 2008 so we were pleasantly surprised to find that renovations are almost done. They now have a new and more spacious lobby, the rooms look better and the staff were noticeably more attentive. I love the fact that this hotel is near the MTR station, Nathan Road, Ocean Terminal and a lot more points of interest around the Tsimshattsui area. The breakfast buffet is quite extensive. Tea selection can be improved but then again, it is only a 3 star hotel. It is great that this hotel has decided to improve on their facilities. The only things missing are free internet and a better tv system but if you are always on the go, these are things that you won't be missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mido7474
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. I would stay here again as the rooms were large enough, the air conditioning just right and the curtains black out the light. (Just right when you need a sleep in the day)

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, never coming back.”
Reviews.Author: OrangeinTraveller
Reviews.Content: Ugly reception desk. So-so clean Rooms. Affordable Price. Staff can't speak a word of English so there was a language barrier all through out. If you like to be near a bustling night life, this is the place for you. Not a place for children. My teenage cousin had a slight traumatic experience near the hotel. As soon as we crossed the road, a pimp was waiting at the other side offering "night-of-fun" for travelers. If this is your kind of fun, then be my guest. Don't get me wrong, the amenities of the hotel were fine. It was my personal horrid experience that really took the cake. Park Hotel was doing renovation at that time, which was fine because we were warned as soon as we checked in. It would've been nicer though if they told us during booking. Sleepless nights were expected but what happened in our bathrooms wasn't. I was sharing a room with my sister and we came home late. While I was freshening up, I heard a scream from the bathroom. Apparently, while my sister was toothbrushing and gurgling, the faucet water turned an ugly (and putrid) shade of brownish-yellow. We called up room service to complain but it took a long time before they finally understood that we wanted them to go up and check the bathroom. It seemed that while renovating, they did some damage with the bathroom pipes and God knows what. After a really short explanation, the staff member who came up began to leave. "That was it? No apologies? No compensation? No nothing??" It's as if they just wanted to ignore the fact that we couldn't use their bathroom and sleep. Knowing that my relatives were upset, I asked the guy for some water so my sister could finish cleaning her teeth and some drinking water, for the fear that she may actually swallowed some of the yellow-brown faucet water. After a loooooooong time, they brought water up...and charged us for it!!!! Good god.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyQld
Reviews.Content: We were a family with two daughters aged 18 and 15. Found the Park Hotel excellent. Great location, only a few minutes to Tsimshatsui subway station. The street had great choice of eating places, especially Charlie Brown's across the street, we had excellent value breakfasts there. We had to have 2 rooms, would have preferred adjoining, but ended up with rooms next door to each other, which was no problem. Rooms were a great size, bathroom facilities were also a very good size, and fittings were 1st class. Rooms were serviced daily, with all bathroom items being replaced, and fresh towels provided daily. The foyer was unfortunately being renovated, and was temporarily located on the 4th floor, but this really had very little impact on our stay there at all. The concierge was fantastic, and booked us a couple of tours, his english was very good. We would highly recommend this hotel to any family. We were very impressed all round.

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Go Wrong Choosing Park !!”
Reviews.Author: sweet30
