Reviews.Content: Great location-very close to Mtr station,just need to walk around 2-3minutes.Next to the Mtr station,is a very famous Hongkong cafe or " char chan teng"by the name of TSUI WAH LAU.Or if you prefer fast food,kentucky & burger king is very near too.If you like to try hongkong Dim Sum,just walk 2 mins to a nearby office complex,go to 3rd floor,you will see a big chinese restaurant(the price is very reasonable).Sorry,forgotten the name of the restaurant,you can ask the bellboy at the lobby,they know the name-coz it's the nearest to our hotel.I highly recommend you to taste it,much much better & tastier than most of our Dim Sum in malaysia. Clean & Spacious-very surprise to find such a spacious room,clean & yet all the room's furnishing & fittings are all new...it's like a brand new hotel !! Walking distance to most of the shopping mall & famous sight seeing place like " Avenue of star" ( just take a 5-10mins walk) ,along the road you can see many factory outlet shop. Modern & comfortable-Everything in the room is New & modern..LCD screen,safety box,comfortable bed & main control switch. Overall was EXCELLENT from top to bottom!! Will definitely come back for my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near shops and waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Ian_CSydney
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel have been recently been totally refurbished. They are spacious and ours at the rear of the building was certainly quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurant gives a generous discount to hotel guests for breakfast. The location is very convenient for the local shopping district. If you are looking for a tailor to make a suit, there are many to chose from close by. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Star ferry. Bus transport is readily available, and the airport shuttle bus (HK 33.00 one way) almost drops you at the door!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile Place To Stay! Stop Considering (:”
Reviews.Author: Shopping_queenz
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel was awesomely lovely to stay in. We're a couple from Singapore, we had a great experience staying in Park Hotel for a total of 7 days and 6 nights. Ultimately, one would wonder whether the renovations at the lobby is disturbing or not. Frankly speaking, the renovations I would say, at most, is unsightly. Besides that, when you're at the lobby, the ground floor. Just ignore those 1 or 2 tailors that are lingering around the pathways across or just outside the hotel. They don't really pester you unless you show much interest. So if you're not into tailoring your clothes, just shoo them away and that will do. (: Other than that, there's basically nothing else to complain about this lovely hotel. I've a couple of pictures here and there for their rooms, lobby, toilets and all. Spick and Span, clean and squek (: When you first arrive there, they usually station a couple of bell boys and a manager to direct you to the 4th floor for the reception/booking into hotel rooms and so. So there's not much of a problem. The only complain that I've about this particular hotel is that I find that certain female receptionists at the desk are not friendly at all. I suppose they could use a little bit more of a smile on their faces when welcoming their guests. It was surprising to find that the male receptionists and managers are much more friendlier than the females. We took the Deluxe Room in the Park Hotel, it was just as spacious as it was shown in the hotel's main website! Location of Park Hotel is at Tsim Sha Tsui, it's a great location. Why so? Because the hotel itself, is surrounded by numerous numbers of eateries and dessert stores! It is also of walking distance around 10-15(max) minutes to the 2 nearest MTR stations named as East Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station and Tsimm Sha Tsui MTR Station. Just below it's hotel, has 2 great eateries. Particularly one called the GuangDong restaurant. But I would prefer calling it a cafe, because of it's mid-level range prices. (: Other than that, there's this famous 'wife cake' bakery just round it's corner called the ''Wing Wah''. Apparently famous for it's ''Lao Po Bing'', one must try and buy it! Pretty cheap. For 6 in a box, it costs only $4SGD. Besides that, every single time whenever we call for room service, to makeup our rooms. I must particularly praise the maid that helps us tidy our rooms, despite seeing that we still do have tubes of shampoo, body bath lying around in the shower room. She never fails to replenish the tubes on the basin. Let's just say we had nevereverending amount of body bath/shampoo for our entire 6 nights stay there (: Also, it's an easy place for one to grab a taxi. Taxis are plentiful over there during the day and nighttime. From Tsim Sha Tsui to headover to Mongkok would usually take you around $8SGD(MAX). It's of extremely close proximity to head to anywhere by taxis. I would say that for the price paid, service given and a comfortable & enjoyable time in Park Hotel. Totally worth it. During our checkout, it was lovely that the hotel conceirge actually allowed us to check in our luggage with them still and head back later only to collect them when were heading to the airport to fly back to Singapore. OH! Particularly busy during nighttime at the corner area there, so be sure to ask for higher levels and non-smoking rooms! I would say, we're definitely returning back to park hotel if we're ever heading to Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking! This is best value for money in HK!”
Reviews.Author: jgr83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park for 2 nights in June 2009. As soon as we checked-in we were immediately upgraded to a superior deluxe room on the 11th floor. Everything was newly renovated, the room was large by all standards, with a nice bathroom and great views. Location is excellent, walking distance to the Walk of Stars, Subway, 7-eleven, McD´s for emergencies! Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice newly renovated rooms & great location”
Reviews.Author: booffy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights in July with a friend. I paid for the cheapest room but i was upgraded to a larger room I suspect it's the Deluxe Room. I'd pass by this hotel in Feb 2007 but i wasn't wholly impressed except for it's location and decided to give it a try. This time the rooms had been renovated. First impressions, not sure what to expect of course since the lobby and entry of the hotel is tiny! You might even find it crowded with mostly chinese touritsts just arriving for their stay. Once i got to my level, i was quite impressed. The hall way was quiet, clean, modern (newly renovated). I loved my room, it was such a great size. it's much bigger in life than what it is in the picture on their website. The bathroom was huge as well with marble floors etc. Room service was excellent. The ladies were always courteous and friendly. Apologetic when they realized we were late sleepers. I was quite impressed by the front desk service. They surpassed my expectations carrying my huge 20kg luggage across the road. He was literally RUNNING in the hot july summer heat with me so that i wouldn't miss the kowloon shuttle bus when i left. The location is right bang in tsim sha tsui. I found it very easy to go around since it's walking distance to the tsim sha tsui station. Also from the station you can walk to harbour city mall (huge!). It's an extremely busy area so expect to be able to find a lot of fast foods and also HK style cafes. There is a shuttle bus down the road that you can take that will take you to the kowloon station so that you can take the train to the airport. I'm giving this a 5 mostly because of value - what I got for the amount I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Readybluedragon
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights our room and bathroomm were large. Everything was spotless and functioned! Air conditioning was too good if anything. All mod cons including tea and coffee facilities, comfy beds, quiet, design lighting and TV with cable tv included. Sure the hotel reception is undergoing renovations and is temporarily located on level 4, which are due to be finished very shortly. It wasn't a drama. The concierge are helpful and so were the concierge at the front door so I was surprised that an earlier reviewer said they had to handle their own luggage. As far as I can tell, there are staff on the ground floor 24 hours a day. Maybe it was a once off incident with the other reviewer?? It is a good location in Tsimshatsui (Kowloon) with all you want closeby - shopping, restaurants and transport. All staff have been courteous, professional and helpful. We asked for an extra towel and toilet paper, and the housekeeper brought up quickly a couple of towels, as well as the toilet paper and a box of tissues (the latter we didn't request). We had breakfast delivered to our room - worked out cheaper than the buffet and at least the food is cooked for you to your order rather than sitting around in a bain marie! Couldn't recommend the Park Hotel highly enough and if we return to Hong Kong, will definitely stay here again. Faultless and spotless! And what a bargain! Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: jinesh_traveller
Reviews.Content: good rooms decent size for hong kong centrally located definately must stay will be first choice

Reviews.Title: “In the Midst of the Hubbub”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel on Chatham Road is a four-star property ideally located. A hotel's location makes a pleasure trip enjoyable and Park's location couldn't be better. It doesn't have the grand harbour view of, say, Shangri-La and Intercontinental (both of which are its neighbours) but then its priced more moderately and is a functional hotel for someone who's not planning to spend too much time in the hotel, instead concentrating on sampling the sights and smells of a vibrant city. You don't get a sense of the size of the hotel from its entrance. That's because currently its lobby and makeshift lobby and reception are both located on the fourth floor. The rooms are smart and comfortable and are not huge, as you would expect in a city where space crunch can felt acutely. The service is pleasant and the food can be very good. The best thing about the hotel--to return to my original point--is its location. You just come down the elevator and step into Tsim Tsa Tsui, which in the heart of Kowloon. The metro rail station is a couple of minutes walk down Chatham Road. Tsim Tsa Tsui is abuzz at all times and it is the best place to get a taste of Hong Kong. Quite literally so, given the number of eateries on Nathan Road, or Peking Road, or the criss-crossing lanes along those major avenues. Non-stop shopping opportunities too. And, no, that Hong Kong is an expensive destination is somewhat of a myth. If you have the luxury of time and are patient, you will find the right place to eat and shop and be happy. Travel is not a problem at all. There's the metro and taxis aren't too expensive. To go across to Hong Kong Island there's the Star Ferry. The Ocean Terminal, the Hong Kong Space Museum and many other places of cultural interest are all in the vicinity of Park Hotel. I would unhesitatingly recommend the hotel for a short stay for a family. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Audrey9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing renovation which I was unfortunately unaware of. The entrance is simply a doorway at the moment amongst shops across a road - so we had no help from our airport driver with luggage which created an immediate poor impression. Upon going up the lift to the 4th floor for the reception - a temporary sheet over old desk arrangement with falling apart sofas to wait did nothing to change this. We were then shown up to a room with 2 twin beds - for a family of 4! I rang the reception to say there had been a mistake and was told for an extra bed I would have to pay an extra $300 a night! Back downstairs we traiped (2 whingy kids in tow) and produced our document from our agent saying we had booked a double plus one extra. They said it was an error with the Hong Kong agent and that we would have to pay extra. After 15 minutes of arguing that it was not our fault and that they should be giving us the appropriate room and fix it up with the agent later, we requested for the head manager who within 30 seconds offered us a room with 2 double beds. Hallelujah. The room was great, bath and all, but the drilling between 8am and 6pm was a bit annoying when trying to rest in the afternoon. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room = good value”
Reviews.Author: plbk4
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent a week in HK at the beginning of the month. It was a public holiday and most hotels were full. We ended up booking at the Park and while expensive because of the timing, it was a very good choice. We caught the Airport Express to Kowloon for HKD90 each one way. There was then a choice of free shuttle buses to take us to our hotel depending on the shuttle route - just ask what bus to jump on for your hotel. These free coaches were a bit of a walk from the train itself but a good way to get to your hotel if you are unsure how far it is by taxi. Renovations are still ongoing at the hotel however this had hardly any impact. Check-in was fast and efficient and we were upgraded to a deluxe room on the 15th floor. Room was great - clean and modern. A touch on the small side and like most Asian countries the bed was very 'firm'. However, the location was fantastic. Near Nathan Road, numerous restaurants, close to the MTRs, all the shopping, the waterfront. All this meant an easy walk to everything while enjoing the alley shops, all the good stuff as well as the Indian touts of course. Overall, a very good hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Have used Park over 30 years”
Reviews.Author: JohnBirchenall
Reviews.Content: For tourists it's perfect now that there is subway and fast train to China basically underneath.In 70's used Park because our office was on Chatam Road next block. Was living in Taiwan at the time. More recently I stay in Shenzhen China most of the time but recommend Park for visitors and guests. No matter if they want to shop, eat or have fun, from Park can be there in 2-3 minutes. 10 minutes to HK side. When they need to come to China KCR is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a short vacation with the wife and kids. Since the ground floor was still being renovated and the corridor leading to the elevators was quite narrow, hotel staff was stationed there to act as traffic police to make sure that those getting in and those getting out of the elevators do not bump into each other. We were upgraded to the 16/F since the hotel was fully booked. The room was clean and newly refurbished. It featured a flat screen tv (but with only a few English channels available like Cartoon Network, BBC, Discovery Channel, CNBC), mini ref, safe, and a convenient central control unit for lights, a/c, tv, etc. Water pressure and hot water were never a problem. The location of the hotel is convenient enough and within walking distance to the MTR, Avenue of the Stars, and many shops. And as previously mentioned, the A21 airport bus will drop you off or pick you up close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pit-stop hotel for a Hong Kong trip”
Reviews.Author: tvarad
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the hotel and got a nice, quiet room but with a view of the rear of some old buildings. The room along with the bathroom was spacious, clean and contemporary though the furniture was scuffed. As others have noted, most of the common areas are closed off for renovation, so there's not much to do in the hotel but who would want to confine themselves to it when there's so much going on right outside? It's a short walk away from the Avenue of the Stars with great views of Hong Kong Island. The MTR station is also within a short walking distance with plenty of shopping on Nathan Road. An added bonus is that the A21 bus from the airport drops you off and picks you up right next to the hotel. For the HK$33 fare, you have the cheapest mode of travel to and from the airport with great views of the city and waterways thrown in for free (best spot is one of the front seats of the upper deck). I give it a 3 star rating because of the work in progress but when that's finished, it definitely deserves an extra star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: perthgirl01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel for 2 nights and the hotel was undergoing major renovations. The lobby was temporarily on the 4th floor and the ground floor completely boarded up. The ceiling was very low on the 4th floor where the restaurant was located, not great if you're taller than about 6 foot 2!! Renovations should be completed by September 2009. The room was nicely renovated (I stayed in a deluxe room), the bathroom neat and tidy. Breakfast was sufficient. I'd rate this a good 3 star hotel - the location is great, right around the corner from Nathan Road and a 3 minute walk to an underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Great Location - Large Room”
Reviews.Author: katie3000
Reviews.Content: Just spent 1 week in the Park Hotel - It is a great location, very close to the metro and within walking distance of many attractions. We were upgraded for free and for no particular reason, which was a welcome surprise. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean, very large (great seeing as most Hong Kong hotel rooms are on the small side). The bathroom was clean and marbled floored. Would definately stay there again and would recommend to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Family”
Reviews.Author: Deslian
Reviews.Content: I like the room, is big, clean and new. I got an upgrade to deluxe room, so this review is based on the deluxe room, it's big enough for me and my family, with 2 adults and kids. The room service is good, I requested for more blanket and it come just 3 min time. The location is great, near MTR station, with 5 min walk and a lot of restaurant nearby. The rate is cheaper here compare to Holiday Inn Golden Mile, which is few blocks away, I'm very happy that I made a right decision to book this hotel after seeing all the reviews in Tripadvisor. Sure will stay in this hotel again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 3 star hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: UrbanGem
Reviews.Content: I read almost all the reviews for this hotel prior to my trip and felt comfortable with what reviewers wrote when we made our decision to stay here. We stayed at Park Hotel for 5 nights last week and it was a very nice experience. As most people mentioned, for a 3-star hotel, we got an excellent deal. We booked through expedia.com (we paid USD $86/week night, and $92/night for weekend, including breakfast) for a Superior room. Note that Holiday Inn Golden Mile is a few blocks away, also a 3-star hotel, but relatively more expensive. We arrived late (after 9pm) our first night (we called prior to let them know), and since it was late, there was no crowd and check-in was a breeze, and we were automatically upgraded to the Deluxe room. As some reviewers mentioned, the hotel is going thru renovation currently, but all hotel rooms have been completed so construction is mainly on the first floor (which is why reception is temporarily on the 4th fl). We stayed on the 14th floor and never heard any construction related noise (staff told us that work is only done during daytime hours). The business center is also under construction, currently they have a temporary one set up - its just a cubicle with a PC and printer, it was a bit expensive, $40HK dollars for 15 minutes, which is the only downside I would mention. Hotel staff was very accomodating, gracious and helpful. The Deluxe room was roomy enough for the two of us, completely remodeled, clean, and very "cute" ,lol. Two complementary bottles of water was supplied in our room every day, and the room had many amenities you would expect from a 4-star hotel: hairdryer, hot water/teapot, room safe, slippers, robes, etc. Breakfast buffet was included with our room, so we took advantage of it every morning. The buffet spread had a "decent" variety, but I thought it was fairly good, a little of everything. I recommend this hotel for those who wish to stay in the Tsim Sha Tsui/Kowloon side of HK, esp if you are interested in shopping. It's in the heart of the area's shopping district with Nathan Rd, and Granville Rd (my favorite) nearby. Its also convenient, being two blocks from the nearest MTR station, and plenty of late night local dining spots. From my experience, this hotel will give you the most bang for your buck and we had no concerns during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best HK 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kodomo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous hotels in HK, for 3 stars and considering the price I paid ( HKD 800), this is probably the best. The room is good size for hong kong standard. I love that it is newly renovated and the decor is modern. The touch screen control panel, LCD TV, comfy bed are all plus point. It is in a very convenient location, 10min walks to Tsimshashui MTR,good sushi shops( half price after 10pm), a couple of local HK cafe, fast food (McD, KFC), Charlie Brown cafe nearby. Walking distance to Avenue of Stars, Harbour city, museum etc. The hotel is on the free shuttle bus route if you take the airport express to city. From Kowloon station, board K3 bus available every 12mins.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl00
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about staying at the Park Hotel because on the map, it looked like it was far from the harbour and shopping. This is not the case. The location of the hotel is excellent. There is good shopping close by and the designer shops are not far away. The Museum of History and the Science Museum are very close and worth seeing. The MTR subway is just at the other end of Cameron Road and is very easy to use if you buy an octopus card (which are easy to buy). The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. The newly renovated rooms were very pleasant and the daily complimentary bottled water was an extra treat (and the supermarket is very close for purchasing additional water). We got a great deal which included a late check out to 4 PM and breakfast daily. The hotel also had a special at the Park Cafe, save 25% off the bill. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: mchou
Reviews.Content: I was booked at another hotel my first night in Hong Kong... but that place was pretty horrible. I immediately hopped onto the internet and found Park Hotel in Hong Kong. I chose it because it was reasonably priced, good location, and had great reviews. I was not disappointed. Despite the lobby being rennovated, the stay was very pleasant. The room was clean, roomy, modern, and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in Hong Kong I really like”
Reviews.Author: bobmy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good, the staff is good, the location is one of the best in Hong Kong and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: 28th_illusion
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with the apartment we rent - as it turned out so small, not what we expected - in Causeway Bay, we started to seek a hotel during our visit. With help from my cousin who currently lives in Hong Kong, he recommended us this Park Hotel with a great fare of only USD90 per room per night! I personally wasn't expecting much, all I cared was to get a decent room to sleep in and this hotel has exceeded my expectations! Basically, for those who visit Hong Kong and want a great hotel with low fares, this hotel is the perfect one for you, as hotels in Hong Kong can be quite expensive. The hotel is located conveniently in Tsimshatsui! With shops spread surrounding the hotel and MTR station just minutes in walking distance! Restaurants are just around the corners, so even at night, you won't find yourself starving in a gloomy hotel room. Without swimming pool and other facilities that make hotel to be superb, this hotel offers truly value for money! The rooms are decent, the rooms are clean and very adequate for sleeping. During our stay, the hotel was going through some renovations, although no noise problems occurred. The lobby itself was small with luggage piled everywhere, but the staff were being helpful and friendly and did their work efficiently. The breakfast was very good too! I was pleased with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Almaden
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The location is perfect for tourists. Easy walk to Nathan Road and the Subway. Lots of stuff to see and do within walking distance. Hotel staff is friendly and professional. Check in was fast and easy. The lobby is awkwardly small so there's lots of luggage piled everywhere but the hotel was in the middle of renovating the first floor lobby area so maybe they will add some room. Nice sized rooms are very appreciated since many rooms in Hong Kong can be quite small. Not here. Bathroom was very clean and up to date. Bed was a little too firm for me but not bad. Nice desk for doing work. Internet access was included in room price. Nice couch and coffee table to relax at. Room safe provided for valuables. My main complain was that all the lights in the room (except the bathroom) are controlled by a box next to the bed. So if you want to turn on the lamp on the desk, you have to get up, walk around the bed, and search for the button on the box amongst several buttons. I stayed here twice in one month on both sides of hotel and so I recommend you ask for a room facing out the front of the hotel. The back side faces other tall buildings which isn't as nice. Hotel had a free buffet breakfast which was nice. Not a lot of choices of food but what they had was good, especially the made-to-order omelets. Hotel is also located 1/2 block from a free shuttle to the Kowloon station where you can pick up the Airport Express Train. Hotel can sell you the Airport Express Ticket too.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated and great location!”
Reviews.Author: alexsolotraveler
Reviews.Content: Paid $125 per night for 3 nights in sept. 2008 through Agora. Hotel lobby is still undergoing renovation, but the rooms and hallways are done. And looks good. NO noise at night as they stop work. Location is in center of commercial Tsim Tsa Tsui, and 5 mins. walk to Tsim Tsa Tsui Metro B2 exit. There is a cheap nice barbecue pork and roast goose restuarant beside it for quick fix when hungry. You can also take airport express train to Kowloon station, then take free shuttle bus K3 which has a stop across Park Hotel. Would definitely stay in this place again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Spyro
Reviews.Content: my daughter and I stayed at the Park Hotel for 4 nights in August of this year. We found the rooms comfortable and clean. The view of the buildings across the road weren't the best - but hey I'm not here to sight see from the room. Bathroom was clean and newish - my only problem here being with the shower over the bath and the positioning of the soap holder. It took up some space where you could really need it - under the water. Front desk staff on our arrival were not the friendliest - the rest of the staff we generally found to be very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet nothing spectacular but it was enough to last us until mid afternoon or longer! The train station is very conveniently located down the road a couple of blocks - easy to get to airport express to and from. Everytime we ventured down the street we noticed something different, and we walked up and down it several times. Don't forget to head across Chatham Road towards McDonalds - great shopping mall and plenty of eateries there - we didn't discover it until our last night and imo it would be a better/nicer walk towards the Avenue of Stars and viewing the Symphony of Lights. Would I stay at Park Hotel again - except that I would like to go somewhere else for the fun of it - I would certainly have no problems with heading back there again. So basically a thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: NatsDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Hotel from 15th - 17th Aug 08. The location is perfect, most of the sights are a stones throw away, plenty of good decent eateries around the area; MRT is less than a min away. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Service staffs are brilliant. All in all we had a great stay and for the price we really got our value for money.

Reviews.Title: “value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: denimautum
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Hotel from the 17th to 20th August. it was a great hotel for its price, very convenient location, relatively near to the MTR, and surrounded by restaurants, shops, etc. renovations are still going on, but we hardly hear the noise though we stayed daily in the hotel until quite late-we went out only at about 4plus...we could hear some lite drilling on and off for about twenty mins per day, but that's about all. the room is not big but good for hongkong hotel and everything is very new and clean. staff was polite and helpful. the free shuttle bus to the airport is just across the road and comes every 12 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Fandelia
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during 2 months and it was very comfortable, convienient, you feel safe in the area, it is right in the center of everything, shopping, restaurant, night life, subway...

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: dymom
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6, including 2 young kids and elderly parents. We stayed at Park Hotel in Kowloon for 4 nights in June, and absolutely loved it!!!!!!!!!! We took the airport bus A21 with 17 pieces of luggage and got off right around the corner of the hotel. Although it took a while to get all luggage to the hotel lobby, service at the hotel really impressed us. The check-in was fast, and our luggage was up in our rooms in no time. Staff was really helpful and provided information whenever we needed, such as the best dim-sum place within walking distance. The hotel facility is all new. There's no more construction inside the hotel. We had 3 rooms on the 6th floor, including 2 inter-connected rooms. It's quiet and very comfortable. Right across the street (Cameron Rd) is a fresh fruit juice place that we bought juice everyday. THe hotel provides 2 big bottles of water free everyday. The location of Park Hotel is superb!!! We walked everywhere - to the Star Ferry, museums, Nathan Road, subway stations, etc. There are tons of restaurants around the hotel and many of them are superb and very very cheap (about US $3-4 per meal per person). The hotel also has a buffet restaurant and buffet breakfast is great. Will stay there again! Thanks so much for all previous reviews that helped me make the decision to stay at Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff couldn't be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Jojingle
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable rooms, gorgeous bed and linen. Staff extremely helpful at all times. Made the chaos of HK bearable!

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay at Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bumsky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights en route from Australia to Europe. We managed to get a good rate for a double room (queen bed). The hotel was easy to get to by airport express train to Kowloon Station and then a free shuttle bus K3 to a stop across the road from the Hotel. We found the hotel clean, comfortable, roomy and convenient for getting around. We could walk easily to the metro station and a bit further to the Star Ferry. We would not recommend the restaurant in the hotel; the food was uninspiring. For a real treat of a meal try the Yung Kee (--), Central. They have won awards for their dishes, particularly roast duck.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, immensely comfortable, good concierge”
Reviews.Author: Friendship88
Reviews.Content: Renovations at the Park Hotel seems to be totally completed. We stayed in the Executive room. The room was very nicely renovated, spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was also renovated and came with the usual amenities. The hotel is in a good location being located within 200m of the Tsim Sha Tsui Station and 300m of the East Tsim Sha Tsui Station (which brings you to ShenZhen) and right smack in the the retail shopping areas. The concierge/reception is very friendly and helpful. Plse ask them for nearby restaurant recommendations bec those that they recommended turned out very well while those that we ventured to by ourselves ( these were 3 restuarants located on the main streets near the hotel) were a disappointment. All in, this is a very good value hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Revamped”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatte
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Park Hotel 10 years ago. Ever since then, I've shunned the hotel on my visits to HK because it was really tired, worn-out and rather depressing to me. This time, I decided to give it another go when I read that it has undergone a complete revamp and the photos of the newly decorated rooms did look good. Besides, I got a very good rate for booking 3 rooms for our 1 night stopover stay from LA. Turned out that I love the newly decorated room. Everything has been changed, from the carpet to the showerhead in the bathroom. Everything is sparkling new. The decor is now sleek, contemporary while cozy at the same time and the water pressure of the shower is good. If I have one thing to pick, it'll be the room service(yeah, I know I'm being a fussy nitpicker here). Room service stops at 11pm so late night snackers like me who are too lazy to go out on the streets again have to go to bed hungry. Overall, I've enjoyed my stay at Park Hotel and I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value All Round”
Reviews.Author: NSKSydney
Reviews.Content: The renovations seem to be almost completed - except for the lobby - at the time of our stay. But there was nothing that interferred with our enjoying the sights, sounds and tastes of Kowloon during the 3 nights we were there.. We were upgraded to the 13th floor and found ourselves with a large room ( by Hong Kong standards) and on par with the better rooms in most Australian and Asian hotels. Everything was in an as new condition, and the styling and decor was of a very contemporary design. All expected fixtures and fittings of a 4 star hotel were in our room. 2 fresh bottles of drinking water were left in our room each day. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the major touristy things in Kowloon, and it is also only a few minutes walk from the nearest MRT stations. The Park Hotel is located on a busy road, but once inside the hotel, you are shut away from the hustle and bustle outside. The buffet breakfast was a bit disappointing - adequate but not outstanding. But still it is possible to "fill" yourself up completely in preparation for a busy day ahead. Would we stay here again ? - Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I was choosing between Kimberley and Park hotel for their location. After much reading in TA, i decided to go for Park hotel and i'm glad i did. I was there from January 24-28, 2008 and i don't have any complaints. Like what you will most likely read here, the hotel has just finished its renovation so everything is new. I asked for a room for three and was expecting it be cramped but i was pleasantly surprised. We were given a quite spacious room, there was enough space to dance around even! :) I love the bed, it was soft and just right to sack in after a whole day of shopping and going around. Bathroom was clean and had new fittings so i didn't mind hanging around the bathroom for long. The hotel is very much well located. Restaurants, shopping, MTR and even money exchange with the best rate (as per my experience) was right across the hotel. MTR is aobut 10 minute walk, but you won't really mind it --- HK is all about walking anyway. I highly recommend Park hotel anytime!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at the park”
Reviews.Author: timmack
Reviews.Content: We had four days in Hong Kong to see the sights. The Park Hotel was ideally situated, close to Tsim Sha Tsui East metro station and within easy walk to shops and restaurants. To get there from the airport , take the airport MTR to Kowloon station and a 10 - 15 minute taxi ride to the hotel. We booked a deluxe room which was about right on space and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a good size, and overall, the room was well maintained.The air conditioning was fine and the room was quiet. Breakfast was varied and plentiful with an international choice. Staff were friendly and helpful. So with all the positives were there any negatives? - only the roadworks outside the hotel but they will probably be finished when you go. If you need assistance while you are there, ask for young George at the Concierge - big smile, big heart, big help.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Deposit”
Reviews.Author: ahmet_2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nigths in this hotel and give 700 US$ deposit. This is much more than 4-nigths price. I don't understand why they make me to pay this amount. The hotel is centrally located in Tsim Sha Tsui (Kowloon) and in walking distance to all atractions in Tsim Sha Tsui (museums, Nathan road, Avenue of Stars etc.) The hotel is really roomy. It is a big plus for this hotel, becuase hotels in Hong Kong are very small. The rooms are also clean. Every morning, they leave an English newspaper to your door. My room is renewed and as far as I know all rooms are renewed. There are LCD-TVs in other hotels, but the TV in my room was a normal TV. A fruit plate is given after check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: BuzzyBeeBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Hi, Please stay at the Park Hotel Kowloon. Our experience was great. The breakfast every morning included a fresh omlette while you wait. Room large,clean, quiet and very comfortable, Bathroom large and well supplied. Hotel walk to everything and in the middle of the action. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: yorkspuds
Reviews.Content: Booked through Asia Rooms. The hotel entrance & foyer are unprepossessing but the rooms, dining room & all other public areas were lovely - all recently renovated. Our room was spacious, quiet & comfortable. In addition to the usual bathroom bits & pieces there was complementary mineral water. Breakfast provided an extensive array of Asian & Western food, all of it good quality - and excellent value. All the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Park and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Chris024
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, Location was good, and it was reasonably priced. We stayed on the 10th floor having been upgraded. The room was big ,clean and had adequate facilities. The ongoing renovation work only seemed to go on between about 10-5 during the day so it wasn't a problem if you spent most of the day out exploring. Overall a good hotel. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on the low floors.”
Reviews.Author: SantaFromNorth
Reviews.Content: My China company's hotel of choice is the Park Hotel when in HK. Between Nov. 2006 through Nov. 2007, the hotel has still been under construction. For my first and second stays, I stayed on the 5th floor. The room was noisy due to the construction, the water pressure was weak compared to other hotels in the area, The channel selection on the TV left much to be desired, and the bed consisted of base sheet and comforter as well as pillows that had seen better days. The dinner buffet leaves much to be desired, go out to one of the many restaurants in walking distance to find a better & cheaper meal. The charge for internet access was out of line compared to some hotels which give you free hi-speed access. After complaining about both stays to hotel management, I was upgraded to a suite on the 14th floor free of charge. What a difference! The floors are quiet, the beds are actually well made with actualy comfy beds by Western standards, flat screen TV was in the room. Everything was better except the internet charges and bad water pressure. At least know the secret next time to booking at the Park, don't except a room near the construction floors if you don't want odd smells in your room and noise.

Reviews.Title: “great except.....”
Reviews.Author: cinlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in Nov and they upgraded us to the junior suites for the three rooms which was great of them. Location is excellent except u dont have the luxury of stopping right in front of the lobby. We had like 8 luggages and 3 kids and we had to walked thru' the busy tiny lane to get to the hotel and likewise when we checked out. Hotel room is sparkling new EXCEPT the toilet. Not sure why they stinged on the water so the flushing system is not up to standard for the 3 rooms we had. Sometimes it is even yellow water........pretty put off by that. Hope they improve on this, else everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Traveller Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catcat18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. We chose this hotel because it is recently renovated. We took Airport Express to the city and then transferred their free shuttle bus to the hotel. In the information, one of the stops of the shuttle bus is Park Hotel. Disappointedly, we found that the bus could not stop in front of the hotel and we need to carry our clumsy suit-cases and walk for 5 mins to the hotel. The hotel is located in a very busy street and also, lots of construction works is carrying-out on the street next to the hotel, everywhere is noisy and dusty. The frontage of the hotel is very small and no car is allowed to stop in front of the hotel. When I stepped in the hotel and disappointed again, that the renovation was still not yet completed. Not only that, the staff at the front desk is not so friendly and helpful, and gave us a very small corner room at the dead-end of the corridor. On the floor plan, we noted that it was the smallest room on the floor. At that moment, I regret to choose this hotel. After approached to the front-desk again, they let us have another room with larger size. We started to settle down and tried to enjoy our stay in this hotel. In HK standard, this room is considered as spacious, everything is new and modern. There are lots of storage space for our luggage and all the lighting, video, audio and air-conditioning are controlled on one panel at the bedside. Honestly, it is comfortable staying in the room and we happy with everything from that moment onwards. When I compare this hotel with the one (Harbour Plaza Metroplolis Hotel) which I booked for another 4 nights, we found this hotel is better money-value, especially when all the renovation is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: rawhiti
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at 9 am totally wrecked after no sleep on the flight from London. The staff were worked off their feet due to massive checkouts that morning after a conference. But they did their best to get a room cleaned for us quickly so we could get some sleep (although official check in time was not for another 5 hours) The room was a good size and well appointed. The bed was a big queen or king size, very comfy and fresh, I didn't notice any noise from renovating, though I believe it is still going on. The lobby is cramped, but I expect this will be sorted by the work currently being undertaken. Porters were also great with our bags and let us leave them there on checkout day, then advised us when our pick up bus arrived and put them on the bus for us. Close to rather a nice Botanic Gardens (off Nathan Road), great on HK's hot humid days, a bit of an oasis in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zhao Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a short trip to enjoy ourselves (shop and eat and shop and eat) in the city of Hong Kong and we were advised to stay at Park Hotel as it just got renovated. We wasn't quite sure if the agent's giving us good advice then cos we wanted to stay at Nathan Hotel initially. When we reached the place, it was STILL renovating (lift lobby area), mind you, but the service and cleanliness of the room is really good. I like the cosy room that we had. It's spanking new and clean. Even though we opt for the smoking room (as there wasn't any double bedroom from the non-smoking area), there wasn't ANY stale smoke smell (perhaps it's just renovated?) The location is good too. You just need to walk about 5 min and the MTR of Tsim Sha Tsui is just down the street. If you are looking for some boutique designer fashion shopping, it's just at the back of the hotel at Granville Road. We visit that place almost everyday. :) Harbour City is also within walking distance. Staff at the reception counter are very helpful and friendly. When asked about the directions of getting anywhere, they're always ready to fish out their very own Hong Kong Map and directory to show you the place. If we are to visit Hong Kong again, I'm quite sure we'll be back there at Park Hotel, without the renovation by then. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Park H.!”
Reviews.Author: femaleTurista
Reviews.Content: stayed at Park with family last august by again relying on fellow trip-advisors' good reviews of this hotel. AGAIN, TA is very accurate. we loved Park!! the twin rooms we got were new, very nice, and clean. nice modern decors and electronic switches to boot. definitely a plus is the clean toilet n bath which is a must for me. though the reception/lobby area is small (part of renovation) and during that time i think the hotel is fully booked so we were made to wait 2hrs for the 2nd room to be ready (we requested for 2 adjacent rooms). but it's just ok since we just brought our stuff to the available room and toured off the nearby streets. there are plenty of shops/boutiques around the hotel, 7eleven just around the corner, there are 2 mcdonalds (one across the street, the other just 2 blocks away), several restos and food shops arround. 1st- you'll never go hungry, 2nd- plenty of shopping around the hotel, 3rd- very near transportation (5mins to mtr tst, taxis around), 4th- area is safe even late at night, 5th- friendly hotel staff, 6th- newly renovated hotel. so what more can you ask for?!! we will definitely stay at park again and recommend this to others too =)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: canuckgirl27
Reviews.Content: Location: About a 3 min walk from the Tsim Sha Tsui subway stop (exit B2). Extremely convenient. Appearance of Hotel: The lobby and some areas are still under renovations so the appearance isn't perfect. For example, lobby check-in area is lacking space & elevator/stairwell signs are not 100% obvious/visible. Note that the above is just an observation and it should not affect your stay. That being said....the hotel is clean and nicely decorated. Quality of Guestroom: All rooms are now renovated. We asked for and got a Queen bed w/ shower (I believe most rooms are doubles with bath). The room was well decorated and furnished. In addition, lighting, cleaniness, noise, amenities (mini bar, tv), climate control were all perfectly fine. Service/Check-in/Check-out: Above average. Housekeeping was very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff was efficient and freindly as well. Check in and out was relatively easy with a minor wait (no more than 5 mins) both times. Internet service (at a charge) worked very well too. Minor inconvenience were slow elevators (I believe they are under renovations too) but once again should not really affect your stay. Surroundings: Located on a very busy corner (I guess it's busy everywhere in HK!) in Tsims Sha Tsui. Tons of establishments withing 5 mins walking distance including: banks, restaurants, fast food, desserts, clothing, electronics, pharmacy, laundry, museums, ferry...list goes on. There is also a basketball court nearby. It was exactly what we wanted. Overall: I would stay here again due the great value (I got a long stay package through the hotel) and my experiences with this hotel. I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient, friendly, clean and affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: pooroldpom
Reviews.Content: cant be beaten value for money..good clean rooms with everything you need friendly staff who are always willing to help in everyway.. location good for shopping/sightseeing/and just about anything you want..have stayed there twice now and will continue to stay there when in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise for a hotel in Kowloon area!”
Reviews.Author: Sin-BK
Reviews.Content: Stay here many times many years ago. Recently came back again and is still very happy about the place. The location : Great. "In the centre of action". Many shops and food joints. And most of them opened till late. A MTR station is just 5 mins walk away. The hotel: when we were there in May 07 the hotel is still renovating. They have refurbished their rooms. So the place is a bit messy. The room: definitely bigger than many hotel rooms in Hongkong Kowloon. The staff: They are helpful with suggestion of where to eat. We do not need direction to shop as we are very familiar with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: zetariel
Reviews.Content: I read reviews from trip advisor on this hotel in july and decided to book this hotel. Many thanks to the reviews. I couldn't agree more that this is a value for money place to stay. We had 2 connecting rooms on the 6th floor. Extra bed were given to us for each room without extra charges. Everything in the room were new. Rooms are spacious and the chamber maid is very friendly and obliging. I am very fussy when it comes to hotel accomodation. So i took a risk even though i knew the hotel is under renovation. We arrived on Sat afternoon. The exterior of the hotel is stil covered up with green mesh. But it doesn't matter. Renovation noise is barely there. Sun there is no renovation on going. We had late check out at 6pm which is very helpful as our flight back home is in the evening. We were able to leave our kids in the room to rest while we continued some last minute shopping. I have stayed in some better hotels in HK before but i must say i am the most satisfied with this stay as everything is perfect! The hotel has great location. It's near to MTR, restaurants, shops. We took the airport bus which is very near to the hotel also. I will definitely consider staying there again !

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: Fussyperson
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reports I wondered what our travel agent had let us in for but all 6 people in our group thought that the hotel was ok and above the 4 star average. Good clean rooms and facilities and a very nice restaurant for a reasonably priced meal. And I am a fussy person when it comes to accommodation!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: queenpurple
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 4 nights staying at the Park Hotel at the end of June. We had adjoining newly renovated rooms on the 6th floor. The renovations were in their final stages, with new shops on the ground floor opening each day. The hotel was recommended by Qantas as a good, convenient, not-too-flashy hotel. It doesn't have the acres of lobby and chandeliers that many other HK hotels seem to have but our rooms were spacious and clean with a small fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, a retractable clothes line above the bath/shower and, very importantly, excellent airconditioning. Public transport access was great, hotel staff were helpful and there was a 7-11 nearby for stocking up on cold drinks. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its awful, infact British Airways have stopped using it after we all complained so much. The only good this about this hotel is the location. The rooms are terrible, they smell of damp and have huge damp patches on the walls and ceilings. The carpets are a disgrace, the beds are very very old fusty and smelly. The curtains are the same. I was devastated when we arrived there, we were travelling in a big group so we just had to put up with it, there wasnt even a bar to socialise in with our friends so we went to the Aussie bar just across the road the Kangaroo Bar, (which i highly recommend). The hotel is undergoing serious renovation, you cant even see out of your window its that bad. In my opinion it should be closed at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel - still under renovations”
Reviews.Author: melach2009
Reviews.Content: While the Park Hotel was in a convenient location with respect to closeness to the MTR and Nathan Road, it did not give us good impression when from the road the whole hotel was "shrouded" in green mesh as it was and is still undergoing renovations. Speaking to one of the friendly staff, we found out that the renovations would be still ongoing for another 12 months. The room that we were initially allocated when we first arrived was in the far corner of the building after having to pass through a fire-door. The room was terrible with flaking paint, musty smell and fading carpets. One redeeming thing was we got transferred to a better room without any hassles when we requested for it. Nevertheless, the bathrooms-cum-toilet was small and was definitely not impressed with its aluminium-lined ceiling at all. Hopefully, with the renovations the size would be enlarged. No complaints about the friendliness of the hotel staff and the service. However, the reception area was small, and not much of an area where you could sit comfortably. Would not consider staying there again, until at least till the renovations are fully completed. But then again ....... This being our second trip to Hong Kong, it would pay to stay in one of the international hotel chains, or at least a four-star rated hotel. Yes, will have to pay a bit more, but my personal feeling is that such is the vibrancy of Hong Kong, it would be a pity to return to a less than comfortable hotel after an exciting day out, even if it just to sleep. Cannot comment on the food within the hotel, but there are enough eating places right around the hotel to tempt the palate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel still under renovation and to be avoided.”
Reviews.Author: dubbo
Reviews.Content: The park Hotel was well below average. After 6 weeks touring Europe we ended up at the Park Hotel for 4 nights. We had ordered a triple superior room suitable for 3 adults. The room allocated was next to the renovation work, a tiny twin bed room and they were going to put a roll away in as well which would have meant that the furniture would have to be taken out of the room. We complained and were given a larger triple room that backed onto the elevators and the room used by the service staff as a utility room, noise most of the night and highly unsatisfactory. The hot breakfasts were terrible but the cold breakfasts were good. This was not what we paid for and we will not be using them again.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have returned today from 6 nights of well YUK after our stay at the Park hotel.Still under renovations after 2.5 years.Smells damp,beds well put it this way my dog had it better than we did.We were a family of 4 Adults 2 Children.No cold water for shower (fixed after we complained)Mould in Bath rooms,no heating except small fan heater.No laundry facilitys except expensive send out laundry.Coffee shop closed under renovations,building work noise started at 9.00am untill late.walls needed painting,Toilet filled basin very close to your backside.Dont be taken in by photos of modern clean hotel all not true,If you can go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: GREENJADE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Hotel for 4D 3N from Nov 26 to 29 for a twin sharing room. It's clean, the room is just enough, though it's not yet renovated. The room has hot and cold water, complete toiletries, hairdryer, empty ref and tv. Since we left in the morning and comes back late in the evening, we didn't feel the noise of the renovation being made. The lobby is quite small, hope it will be bigger after renovation. My comment is you can hear the sound of the vehicles from the outside, though it didn't bothered us. It's two blocks away from the MTR TST station in Nathan Rd, and this is the most important thing coz you can go anywhere to the great tourist spots. There are lots of small stores in the vicinity, like 7-11 watsons,photo/cellphone, drugstore, eatery, tailor, mcdo and souveneir shop for your last minute shopping. You can walk from the hotel towards the kowlooon park and ocean center/terminal where the big shops are. One night from the Avenue of Stars we just found ourselves just walking to the hotel. The staff are great and will assist you patiently and tell you where to ride / exit and how to go back to your place. You can leave your bags for a late check-out w/o addl charge. Safe and great location, I recommend this hotel for your trip in HK.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.61-65 Chatham Road South, Tsimshatsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
